Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  World Social Forum: Activists Urge Free Open-Source
  Software 

--=====================_14688971==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


World Social Forum: Activists Urge Free Open-Source Software

By Alan Clendenning

January 30, 2005 by the Associated Press


PORTO ALEGRE, Brazil -- Activists at a leftist gathering
where Microsoft is viewed as a corporate bogeyman urged
developing nations Saturday to leap into the information age
with free open-source software.

John Barlow, a lyricist for the Grateful Dead, told a
gathering inside a packed warehouse that poor nations can't
solve their problems unless they stop paying expensive
software licensing fees.

Open source software includes programs that are not
controlled by a single company. The software can be developed
by anyone, with few restrictions. The best known such
software is the Linux operating system, which can be
downloaded free from the Internet.

"Already, Brazil spends more in licensing fees on proprietary
software than it spends on hunger," said Barlow, co-founder
of the Electronic Frontier Foundation, a cyberspace civil
liberties group.

MORE:  http://www.commondreams.org/headlines05/0130-03.htm




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands 
of the bosses and their employers, the special interests.  An invisible 
empire has been set up above the forms of democracy."
-Woodrow Wilson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Starlight Jen & LoL... Wow!!  1015 was kinda like Wow... I mean.. I ain't
been there in like I dunno... 2 months.. & like man.. their still doi'n
like mondo reconstructions 2 the club!  So Dope!!  I swear, the front room
is like WOW!!  Eventhe bathrooms were all futuristic/ space-agey

I Loved the music!!  Breabeats the whole night.. I mean.. I duno who the
main act was that night.. those tag team DJs, but man.. they were sick!!

club, old school house.. everything, & it was all progresive & thumpin' &
yummy!!!  LOVED IT!!  DMAO the whole time i was there!!

So around like 1AM, Jen & I went 2 Sublounge & well.. it was closed =(

So we went 2 Ryan's 4 his goin' away!! fuck man... it was a Happy/ Sad
night... Love U Ryan!!  Ranger.. U just left when we got there!!!  Grrrrr!

Honestly.. 1015 waS.. I mean.. the crowd there was a total mix of like
well... psy trance hippes, club kids, bboys/ bgirls, Groovers, Wow... it
was Awesome!

It was Dope... Saw alota people there I didn't expect 2 C & didn't C
people I was hopin' 2 c... c'est La Vie...

Yeah.. I endedup leaving Ryan's Drunk off my ass!  LoL

Subject: [sfraves] The FURIOUS2 Ride Home w/ Dina! PT1

This is a true story mind U!  I mean.. every time I'm graced w/ a ride
home from Dfly.. some crazy shit always happens!!  So like I kinda cut
from Furious2 like a lil' earlier than expected, but ya know... since it
was a ride on the way 4 other people 2 like go home, then it's all good &
thankfully Dfly & Terri were nice enough 2 do that!!  YAY!!!  Granted I
was invited 2 get laid 2 times like minutes b4 I was leaving & although it
wass temping 4 me 2 stay even just 4 that... ooh...oooooooooh.. i think
getting home when i coulda was like more Mondo important!

So we were cruisin home in the Dfly Mobile talkin' about the shindig &
ofcourse, gossiping about who was there & what was saw & who saw what as
well as who heard what with whom & where, ya know!!  Oooh my Goodness,
Hello 2Day, if the walls could talk!

So like the not even when we were off that mondo bridge ramp thingie that
connects 2 80, we saw HUGE bniking signs telling us that lanes were
closed..

"Oh great.. back roads 2 Hercules then!" I thought.  "Well, this is
perfect 4 catch up time!"

The freeway construction led us to the Ashby Exit off 80 (hmmm... familiar
from the last time Dina brought me home)...

"Osby, U know how to get home from here & tell me where to drive, right?"
Dina asked me!

"Duh!!" I said!  "Hey Divafly, U saw that girl flash U when U were
spinning, right?" I asked...

"Dude, that girl flahed me like 5 times while i was spinning!  I dunno
man.. her tits are Big & fake, I don't like that!" she said

"Wait U 2," Terri said as we pulled up 2 a stop light, "that's the same
girl that kept wanting me 2 kiss her the whole night.. she had that
feather thing on her hat, right???  Oh my gosh, she squeezed my boobs &
told me she really wanted me to kiss her!  I was like eeew!"

Me & Dina looked @ each other & laughed so hard!  I dunno man.. that was
so funny 4 some reason!!!  But it like alright ben' delirious @ 3:30 AM,
right?  So like just as we finished laughing, the light turned green & the
phone rang!!!

"Hell... Ma???  Ma... what's so funny??  Did u just get back from the
Shark & seafood feed right now??  uh hu.. who??  Really???
ahaaaaaahahahaha.. Ma you're 2 much... you're so fuckin' hillarious!"

"Yo D.. yer suppose to tur..." I said as dina missed the turn she was
suppose 2 like turn...

"Ma, I'm gonna drive Osby HOme then we're gonna crash at your boat house
on the Carquniez Dock.. OK??? yeah.. yeah.. I know, don't let the Turtles
take a bath w/ Terri, yeah, we brought our wetsuits to sleep in the
waterbed, yeah Ma, I know... Love U too, BaBye!" & hung up... "Sorry Oz,
is there another turn we can take?"

"Yeah, here comes Telegraph, we can turn here...."

Dina Turned right....

"...make a left I was gonna say ummmm.. ok.. this is Groovy!" I said as I
laughed...

"Dude, U tell me 2 turn b4 we turn!"

"Hey guys, what the fuck is that running down the street?" Terri yelled as
we looked!  A bull was running down the street, weird!  "Hey, there's a
burger joint.. let's eat, my treat!"  So we went 2 the burger place &
ordered food!

"Hey... that's that gay bar/ club place there on the corner where I spun 4
a stripper once," Dina said!  So we looked!  There was all this noise
comin from there & a bunch of chicken feathers like in front of the
door...

"Oh oh oh.. I wanna go see what's goin' on in there!" I said as i heard
Dina & Terri yelling my name to go back 2 them!! Then I heard loud shoes
running towards me & looked behind me... it was Terri & Dina running
also...

"Osby... slow down, we're coming to!" Terri said as she was running in her
8 inch cloggy tap high heals!

We got 2 the door & it was cracked open

"Oh Shit.." the 4 of us said @ the same time... (Oh yeah.. I took my
invisble friend Bob w/ me 2 the party)

OK... I'll stop here 4 now & continue when I wakeup!  Crazy!!  It gets
better!  Night Night!

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: 2nd Anniversary of a sad thing .... 

-------------------------------1107269457
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Two years ago today, I was relaxing after a great party and was up all  night 
(you know how that goes, all that energy after a great party). I turned on  
the TV and said, "wow what a coincidence, the space shuttle is landing right  
now! I really turned the TV on at the right time."
 
Uh huh. Just after I started watching, the shuttle turned into a ball of  
flame. What did I just see? The people on the news didn't know what to say at  
first. Then, I was transfixed as they started to realize and describe what had  
just happened. They played it over and over. What a sad thing to see when 
coming  down from all the great party energy ... sad thing any time, I mean, but  
especially when feeling so happy before. 
 
So yeah ... I am not a fan of Bush's space program but I love space travel  
in general. ok the shuttle's orbit was very close to the earth's surface and  
barely qualifies as "space," but it still counts. 
 
yesterday's newspaper showed that a newly designed shuttle fuel tank  arrived 
at the Cape. Supposedly the same kind of accident can't happen again. No  
spray-on foam insulation. 
 
One good thing, I guess, is that we've learned to work well with the  
Russians. 
 
That's it, i gotta leave for work. I hope everybody has a great week,
JonnyR 
 
p.s.  I haven't been to any parties in a while but I'll be  back

-------------------------------1107269457--

donb <mutex@drghetto.com> wrote:
Also... what about Thump, Blue Room parties at 550? The whole psytrance 
side of the scene? Not really my thing but it has played a big part in 
shaping our bay area music scene. You might want to get someone to chime 
in on that part of the history if this is to be a complete effort.

donb



AndyW wrote:

>Yeah, and the gap at 1997-2000 is a weird one, seeing as list membership
>was highest during those years.
>
>I'd like to sit down with some people that were active during that period
>that I don't really know all that well and figure out what should be
>added.
>
>Considering some of the most incredible parties I ever attended happened
>during that time period...
>
>Gateway Systems - Chrysalis (gateway wasn't too into SFR, but you saw a
>lot of SFR kids at Gateway events)
>
>Harmony - Wrinkle in Time, Beautiful People, Freaky People, 3 year at Camp
>Swig, Spring Massive
>
>FnF's first campouts and expanding underground offerrings
>
>Cloud Factory growing outside the Monterey/Salinas roots
>
>Viberation - in many ways the most SFR involved collective (terry + mikem
>+ andyw + siphon + science + micron + li... all active SFR netizens).
>
>ASR - Always a balancing act between Jeremy (and later Tony's) vision and
>a collective wtih a lot of, the result was a lot of good parties.
>
>Happy Kids - while I had issues with the crew at the time, they really did
>come up with some of the best spaces and had a fanatical following.
>
>NBC - Petaluma / Sonoma / San Rafael freaks.
>
>Children of the Sun - While burning a few bridges in the process, COTS
>managed to bust a party every couple weeks for a while there, and managed
>to create a lot of memories.
>
>Warmth - I was never a big Spencer fan, but lots of people "got it" in
>the crew, and they did have their hearts in the right place.
>
>BBQ & Beats - Not too many parties, but one of my favorite completely
>illegal renegades of all time... a 3 day free outdoor campout with ZERO
>permits, $10 for meals all weekend from a champion BBQ cook, and the
>craziest mix of genres I've ever heard at one party.
>
>Orphan - East bay nutters.
>
>Oh shit, and that first light where $20 got you Entrance.
>
>The crackhouse on 13th. Acme warehouse, the old dance studio, the old
>clementina alley spot, psytrance, casa z, the old f8 studio/hangar in
>north bay, the phoenix, 2nd and jax, homebase, richmond point molate,
>static, mad, sabotage, eklectic, bass kru...
>
>How good were those parties? I'll put it this way... so many of the
>people I met at those events, are still going... while I've seen people
>that got into it years later totally fall out after a year or two. Could
>it have been that the parties back then were *that* good? I dunno, seems
>like a strange ommission as far as time stretch... this was the second
>underground that came out of the cave-in that started in 94. Everybody
>had given up on it, but it was still going... not running on nostalgia...
>we were still mentally young but wiser than newbies, still loving it, the
>scene had a great cross section of it with people from 15 to 65 attending
>the same parties with the same enthusiasm, there were parties where "vibe"
>was not a glassy eyed dream but a tangible fog of friendly sweat and
>intentions, and we were just high as fark on what we were doing.
>
>In the end, not sure how much of an effect it had as a movement or
>whatever, but I know a lot of people that are forever changed. Some for
>worse, most for better I think. The big parties nowadays are still
>plagued by the same cost cutting, limits on freedom and ethical
>shortcuts... but there was a period where several thousand people were
>involved in a very alive, very optimistic and vital underground that I'm
>not sure will ever happen again here.
>
>andyw
>
>andyw - mutorsoundsystem - saturn5.com/andy
>\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/
>"Nothing real can defeat us. Nothing unreal exists." - Buckaroo Banzai
>
>On Fri, 28 Jan 2005, Brandon S. wrote:
>-&e->i'd like to see the Ascension weekly at Blake's included in the timeline.
>-&e->it's where i first met a lot of SFR folks. i remember running into Mike
>-&e->Stickyboy there after he posted that he'd be there in a black hat. and i
>-&e->bought a ticket for a Viberation party there from Ryan.
>-&e->
>-&e->--------------------------
>-&e->< Brandon / DJ Bam >
>-&e->
>-&e->DJ Bam - serving breaks and beats
>-&e->http://www.invibe.com/bam
>-&e->
>-&e->January 29th: Furious II
>-&e->February 19th: Dirty
>-&e->March 19th: Evil Breaks One Year Anniversary Party
>-&e->April 29th: Lee Coombs @ Mighty
>-&e->--------------------
>-&e->---------------------
>-&e->
>-&e->
>-&e->>From: Karina 
>-&e->>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>-&e->>Subject: [sfraves] SFRaves makes history! SFR is a te0enager!
>-&e->>Date: Fri, 28 Jan 2005 00:36:55 -0800 (PST)
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Dear SFRaves Community and Brian Behlendorf,
>-&e->>
>-&e->>I wanted to take the time to appreciate the fact that SFRaves as a
>-&e->>community and a resource is turning 13 this year! What a wonderful
>-&e->>accomplishment. Thank you for being such an instrumental, innovative,
>-&e->>creation. SFRaves and Hyperreal are a treasure to be cherished. Happy
>-&e->>Birthday! (coming in March) SFRaves! We should have a birthday party for
>-&e->>SFRaves / Hyperreal .org :)
>-&e->>
>-&e->>http://www.sfraves.org/history/
>-&e->>http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf
>-&e->>
>-&e->>SFRaves History:
>-&e->>
>-&e->>A Brief History of SFRaves
>-&e->>
>-&e->>1992: SFRaves Connects
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * 3.92 - SFRaves is born. Brian Behlendorf is the proud daddy. The
>-&e->>address at the time is sfraves@petrus.berkeley.edu.
>-&e->> * 4.11.92 - Battle of the Juggernauts: Toon Town's UFO's are Real vs.
>-&e->>the Gathering. Many SFRavers meet for the first time. I get my SFRaves
>-&e->>button, now a collector's item :).
>-&e->> * 5.2.92 - The first SFRaves picnic, over in the East Bay at Joaquin
>-&e->>Miller Park.
>-&e->> * 5.92 - SFRaves moves to soda.berkeley.edu.
>-&e->> * 7.92 - Plans begin for the first big SFRaves bash, planned for Bonny
>-&e->>Doon.
>-&e->> * 7.30.92 - After some prodding, Brian realizes "Connection" is a
>-&e->>better name than "Conn-X-tion". Other rejected names: DeepByte, chmod u+x,
>-&e->>Contact, Outernet.
>-&e->> * 8.20.92 - Connection goes off in a big way at Bonny Doon Beach. Word
>-&e->>eventually reaches the full moon massive, which hold a series of
>-&e->>also-legendary parties there in the coming months.
>-&e->> * 9.25.92 - SFR produces Alternity in the basement of 1015. We fear
>-&e->>that the show "48 Hours" would film there, but they don't show.
>-&e->> * 9.92 - SFRaves outgrows soda and is moved to medisg.stanford.edu
>-&e->>(aka sfraves.stanford.edu and techno.stanford.edu)
>-&e->> * 11.92 - Brian discovers a "HUGE squarish open space" in the Berkeley
>-&e->>Marina. The grass is never the same again.
>-&e->> * 11.92 - vrave is born
>-&e->> * 12.9.92 - first-known reference to "luv phasers". Niels refers to
>-&e->>"ravers with...forehead mounted love-phasers...enforcing positive vibes"
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Other highlights: Sundays in Marx Meadow, Full Moon parties, Come/Unity,
>-&e->>Wicked, Woopy Ball, Osmosis, Housing Project, the Gathering, Deep Faith,
>-&e->>Sharon, Equinox, Basics, Funky Tekno Tribe, New Year's Eve Gathering.
>-&e->>1993
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * 1.93 - The SFRaves/socal-raves X-country ski trip in Yosemite. Dana
>-&e->>ties my boom box to his backpack and we listen to Spun's tape while skiing
>-&e->>the back country in Yosemite.
>-&e->> * 2.2.93 - was supposed to be the last Come/Unity.
>-&e->> * 3.13.93 - Connection 2 planned for a spot in northwest SF. Rain
>-&e->>forces it into the Charter Oak warehouse, but it is busted partway into
>-&e->>Scott Hardkiss's set. After some scrambling, and a regrouping at the Cala
>-&e->>Foods, the party is moved to the Berkeley Marina and rewards the SFRavers
>-&e->>who brave a light drizzle. Jon Drukman plays on one turntable for a while,
>-&e->>leading into sets from Moonpup, Lee and Blurrrr. Bob Ramstad may still have
>-&e->>tapes :)
>-&e->> * 4.93 - The San Francisco community gets together to throw a benefit
>-&e->>party for Malachy, who was seriously injured after the full moon party
>-&e->>early in March.
>-&e->> * summer '93 - the South Bay lunch begins. I think the first one was
>-&e->>at Jing Jing in Palo Alto, then it is agreed that it works better as a
>-&e->>bring-yr-food picnic in Greer Park.
>-&e->> * 7.29.93 - I take over the SFR calendar from Brian.
>-&e->> * 9.5.93 - Liquid Grooves at Crissy Field in San Francisco. This
>-&e->>started a string of Liquid Air parties, leading up to the first Friends and
>-&e->>Family at the Blue Cube. The original group of Liquid Air DJs included
>-&e->>Ethan, Bryce, Tamara Palmer, Jon Drukman, Lee An, and Laura La Gassa.
>-&e->> * 10.3.93 - Lee F., along with Ethan and Bryce throw Connection Earth,
>-&e->>an SFR-sponsored party at Marx Meadows in Golden Gate Park.
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Other highlights: Your Sisters' House, Boogie Buffet, Together, Zanzibar,
>-&e->>Mission Rock, Groove Kitchen, MESS, Fluid Groove
>-&e->>1994
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * 1.15.94 - the first Friends and Family goes off in the Blue Cube.
>-&e->>Ethan, Bryce and the F&F collective pull it all together after learning the
>-&e->>ropes with fluid groove and liquid air. Subsequent F&F's pack Klub Komotion
>-&e->>with a hot & sweaty group of revelers.
>-&e->> * 5.28.94 - Lee F. takes the lead in the SFR-organized party "In the
>-&e->>Light" at the bandshell in Golden Gate Park.
>-&e->> * 7.94 - Hyperreal comes up and SFR is moved to it.
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Other highlights: Sunset, Pure Space, Organic
>-&e->>1995: SFR: Friends & Family
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * 3.95 - The SFR Calendar goes up on the web
>-&e->> * 3.95 - Thanks to the Zippies, SFR has a record 1080 messages over
>-&e->>the month.
>-&e->> * 8.95 - Friends and Family outgrows Komotion and produces the first
>-&e->>of two stellar parties in an Oakland warehouse. The F&F Collective grows to
>-&e->>many dozen people. The first is so wildly successful that 600 tickets for
>-&e->>the next F&F sell out in advance, in one weekend.
>-&e->> * 9.16.95 - Net.ravers from across the country gather and celebrate
>-&e->>Brian and Laura's wedding with a pre-party at Bonny Doon Beach. They are
>-&e->>married the next day.
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Other highlights: Sunset, Simply Done, the Gardening Club, Frequency 8,
>-&e->>Area 51.
>-&e->>1999: SFR: Best Local Online Rave Resource
>-&e->>SFR
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * .99 - SF Raves won the SF Bay Guardian Best Of The Bay 1999 Award
>-&e->>for Best Local Online Rave Resource!
>-&e->>
>-&e->>2000: SFR Keeps Going Till the End of the 20th Century
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * 3.00 - SFR 8 Years in the Mix - D.O.B. March 1992
>-&e->>
>-&e->>2001: SFR Keep's On Thumpin Into the 21st Century
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * 1.01 - SF Raves is 9 years Old, in the Mix
>-&e->> * 4.07.01 Epiphany - Ponies and Stuff
>-&e->> * 4.26.01 - SF Raves throws Relic - a party to Remember
>-&e->> * 5.01 - SF Raves' server taz, is retired, new and improved
>-&e->>taz3.hyperreal.org is born
>-&e->> * 5.05.01 - SFRavers gather for a house party called Mexicon
>-&e->> * 5.12.01 - Free Beats Throws a Notable Renegade Party in Berkeley, CA
>-&e->> * 5.17.01 - Oxygen - A bi-weekly Party at the Oxygen Bar, leaves many
>-&e->>fond memories in the mind of Karina
>-&e->> * 5.22.01 - SF Ravers Justin Hale and Michael Liu throw a fabulous
>-&e->>party in the South Bay Called Secret Society
>-&e->> * 6.16.01 - Fond Memories of Parties in GGP
>-&e->> * 6.16.01 - Sf Ravers from Butterzone.net throw a fond weekly shindig
>-&e->>called Sunday of Slack
>-&e->> * 6.28.01 - Local Collective Epiphany has a three year anniversary
>-&e->>party
>-&e->> * 7.07.01 - Eklektic makes its mark as a place for Junglists
>-&e->>
>-&e->>2002: SFRaves Celebrates its Decade Anniversary
>-&e->># SFR-P throws Amalagamation
>-&e->># 09.29.02 -
>-&e->>SFRaves 10 YEAR ANNIVERSARY!
>-&e->>A Decade of SFRaves !!! - FREE OUTDOOR PARTY in the Park !!!
>-&e->>*** SFRaves History: SFRaves 10 Year Archives ****
>-&e->>Bringing the SFR Community an unforgettable day in the Sun, to enjoy and
>-&e->>celebrate a decade of Music, Dance, Friendship and experiences of SFRaves
>-&e->>over the past 10 years. Experience the celebration through the expression
>-&e->>of ecclectic sound, intriguing memoires and a diverse memorabilia of
>-&e->>flyers, music, art and dance of spanning 1992 - 2002. Sound provided by
>-&e->>Neuroscience Creations.
>-&e->>Your lineup is as follows:
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * Brian Behlendorf (SFRAVES, Connection, Hyperreal.org)
>-&e->> * Ethan (Friends and Family) [www.bass-station.com/FnF]
>-&e->> * Galen/Solar (Sunset/Pacific)
>-&e->> * AndyW & Li [on 4 decks] (Viberation, Resource Records)
>-&e->>[www.viberation.com]
>-&e->> * Amber & Drag'nfly [on 4 decks] (Sister, DNA, sfr-p, Teknique,
>-&e->>Epiphany) [www.iamthedj.com] (Amber) & [www.djdragnfly.com]
>-&e->> * DJ2 (Moksha Tribe, Live Funk/Electro/Acid performance (Drag'nfly)
>-&e->>
>-&e->>This event is ALL AGES AND FREE!!! Free refreshments and snacks. 12pm-6pm @
>-&e->>the beautiful McLaren Amphitheater, in San Francisco, CA
>-&e->>* Map and Directions: http://members.aol.com/peyote4000/map.htm
>-&e->>* Infolines: 415.564.4768 or 415.789.8236 **http://www.sfraves.org**
>-&e->># SFR Calendar is redesigned and a new Hyperreal/SFR interface for the
>-&e->>calendar are launched.
>-&e->>SFRaves/Hyperreal Rave Interface includes
>-&e->>
>-&e->>
>-&e->>SFR Calendar
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Calendar
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Groups
>-&e->>
>-&e->>People profiles
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Polls
>-&e->>
>-&e->>2003
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * SFRaves/Hyperreal Rave Interface grows in functionality, people and
>-&e->>size. The SFR Calendar is enhanced with multiple features. Features are
>-&e->>updated to include enhancements in the Events Calendar, Event Calendar
>-&e->>Interface, Groups, User/People profiles, Polls
>-&e->> * SFRaves continues to grow at 11 years of age.
>-&e->>
>-&e->>2004
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * SFRaves/Hyperreal Rave Interface reaches the 1.0 milestone. SFR
>-&e->>calendar features continue enhancement and shift direction to broaden scope
>-&e->>and improved Quality standards.
>-&e->> * Updated features: Events Calendar, Event calendar Groups,
>-&e->>User/People profiles
>-&e->> * User Registration has skyrocketed to 258 groups and 1666 people as
>-&e->>of September 2004!
>-&e->> * SFRaves has joined the Networking revolution: SFRaves @
>-&e->>Livejournal.com, SFRaves @ Tribe.net, SFRaves @ Friendster.com, SFRaves
>-&e->>Myspace Group and SFRaves @ Myspace, and SFRaves @ Orkut.com
>-&e->> * SFRaves serves the community for 12 years strong!
>-&e->>
>-&e->>2005
>-&e->>
>-&e->> * SFRaves Calendar continues to grow in reach, registration of Users,
>-&e->>Groups and features.
>-&e->> * SFRaves becomes a teenager in 2005! 13 years and counting...
>-&e->> * SFRaves continues branches out and networks nonstop. The community
>-&e->>has grown by leaps and bounds to include direct networking connections on
>-&e->>various sites on the web. As a result, both the user base and the breadth
>-&e->>of our community has an extended reach and continues to grow.
>-&e->> * SFRaves Calendar User Registration has skyrocketed to 310 groups and
>-&e->>1985 people as of January 2005!
>-&e->> * SFRaves Network Contacts: SFRaves @ Livejournal.com, SFRaves @
>-&e->>Tribe.net, SFRaves @ Friendster.com, SFRaves Myspace Group, SFRaves @
>-&e->>Myspace and SFRaves @ Orkut.com
>-&e->> * SFRaves serves the community for 13 years strong!
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Would you like to add to SFRaves.org history? Please send comments,
>-&e->>suggestions and other stories to karina@hyperreal.org
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Thanks!
>-&e->>
>-&e->>Karina
>-&e->>
>-&e->>--
>-&e->>**************************************************************
>-&e->>******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
>-&e->>If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
>-&e->>much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
>-&e->>& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
>-&e->>-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
>-&e->>**************************************************************

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: sex music

quoth CHUCK G:
> How about for a soundtrack during
> wicked-evil-kinky-right-now-I'm-on-(fill in your favorite eh-hum here)
> sex?

Erm, maybe. IMO, though:

NIN != sexy. I thought they were before I'd ever even had sex, but now
they just seem a little contrived. Possible exception: "Reptile".

Chemical Brothers != sexy. Tom and Ed are just too nerdy to make sexy
music, period.

The Prodigy != sexy. They just all seem like a bunch of tweakers to me,
and their music reflects that. Some stuff on Jilted might be deep enough
for getting down, but I can't say I'd ever put their CD on if I were
expecting to get laid.

Here are some suggestions off the top of my head:

Aeroc - Viscous Solid (made entirely from sampled acoustic guitars)
Cylob - Cylobian Sunset (classic ambient/IDM)
FSOL - Lifeforms (no embellishment necessary))
Fabric 12 - The Amalgamation Of Soundz (great progression!)
Herbert - Around the House (deep, sexy click-house)
Massive Attack - No Protection (dub mixes by Mad Professor)
Nightmares on Wax - Carboot Soul (dubbed out vocal trip-hop)
Peter Kruder - Peace Orchestra (ultra-deep dischordant sex music)
Thomas Fehlmann - Lowflow (deep, dubby houseno)

Cheers,
-- 
shawn allen
  mailto://shawn@alterior.net
  phone://+1.415.577.3961
  http://alterior.net
  aim://shawnpallen

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] Spirit of Raving Q: What was your most memorable party between 199

1)  the day i met Osby.  Unity party at SF City Hall.  i went to the party 
alone but ran into several friends.  i remember seeing a photo of Osby that 
someone posted a link to on SFR months earlier.  then, all of a sudden, i 
saw this dude who looked like the photo.  this was on the marble steps of 
city hall.  so i went up to him and introduced myself.  two things i 
remember. one, i realized "damn, this guy talks just like he writes on SFR." 
  two, he asked me if i liked happy hardcore.  i said "no."

2)  thump at 550.  disco d was in the back room.  i got osby fucking drunk.  
i got my newly turned 21 friend leslie drunk.  some dude kept hitting on her 
and asked me if she was single.  that dude was moshen, who became a good 
friend of mine.  that night, i met Tim and Eva for the first time.  we all 
went out for food afterwards.  Tim and Eva recently got married and are now 
my housemates.

3)  the night i met Veanne.  it was outside 550.  i danced.  she called me a 
"fucking raver" and laughed at me.  and i thought to myself "damn, i hope i 
run into this girl again."

of the bosses and their employers, the special interests.  An invisible 
empire has been set up above the forms of democracy."
-Woodrow Wilson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

> On Fri, 28 Jan 2005 00:36:55 -0800 (PST), Karina <karina@hyperreal.org> w=
rote:
> > Dear SFRaves Community and Brian Behlendorf,
> >
> > I wanted to take the time to appreciate the fact that SFRaves as a
> > community and a resource is turning 13 this year! What a wonderful
> > accomplishment. Thank you for being such an instrumental,
> > innovative, creation. SFRaves and Hyperreal are a treasure to be
> > cherished. Happy Birthday! (coming in March) SFRaves! We should have a
> > birthday party for SFRaves / Hyperreal .org :)
> >
> > http://www.sfraves.org/history/
> > http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf
> >
> > SFRaves History:
> >
> > A Brief History of SFRaves
> >
> > 1992: SFRaves Connects
> >
> >      * 3.92 - SFRaves is born. Brian Behlendorf is the proud daddy. The
> > address at the time is sfraves@petrus.berkeley.edu.
> >      * 4.11.92 - Battle of the Juggernauts: Toon Town's UFO's are Real =
vs.
> > the Gathering. Many SFRavers meet for the first time. I get my SFRaves
> > button, now a collector's item :).
> >      * 5.2.92 - The first SFRaves picnic, over in the East Bay at Joaqu=
in
> > Miller Park.
> >      * 5.92 - SFRaves moves to soda.berkeley.edu.
> >      * 7.92 - Plans begin for the first big SFRaves bash, planned for B=
onny
> > Doon.
> >      * 7.30.92 - After some prodding, Brian realizes "Connection" is a
> > better name than "Conn-X-tion". Other rejected names: DeepByte, chmod u=
+x,
> > Contact, Outernet.
> >      * 8.20.92 - Connection goes off in a big way at Bonny Doon Beach. =
Word
> > eventually reaches the full moon massive, which hold a series of
> > also-legendary parties there in the coming months.
> >      * 9.25.92 - SFR produces Alternity in the basement of 1015. We fea=
r
> > that the show "48 Hours" would film there, but they don't show.
> >      * 9.92 - SFRaves outgrows soda and is moved to medisg.stanford.edu
> > (aka sfraves.stanford.edu and techno.stanford.edu)
> >      * 11.92 - Brian discovers a "HUGE squarish open space" in the Berk=
eley
> > Marina. The grass is never the same again.
> >      * 11.92 - vrave is born
> >      * 12.9.92 - first-known reference to "luv phasers". Niels refers t=
o
> > "ravers with...forehead mounted love-phasers...enforcing positive vibes=
"
> >
> > Other highlights: Sundays in Marx Meadow, Full Moon parties, Come/Unity=
,
> > Wicked, Woopy Ball, Osmosis, Housing Project, the Gathering, Deep Faith=
,
> > Sharon, Equinox, Basics, Funky Tekno Tribe, New Year's Eve Gathering.
> > 1993
> >
> >      * 1.93 - The SFRaves/socal-raves X-country ski trip in Yosemite. D=
ana
> > ties my boom box to his backpack and we listen to Spun's tape while ski=
ing
> > the back country in Yosemite.
> >      * 2.2.93 - was supposed to be the last Come/Unity.
> >      * 3.13.93 - Connection 2 planned for a spot in northwest SF. Rain
> > forces it into the Charter Oak warehouse, but it is busted partway into
> > Scott Hardkiss's set. After some scrambling, and a regrouping at the Ca=
la
> > Foods, the party is moved to the Berkeley Marina and rewards the SFRave=
rs
> > who brave a light drizzle. Jon Drukman plays on one turntable for a whi=
le,
> > leading into sets from Moonpup, Lee and Blurrrr. Bob Ramstad may still
> > have tapes :)
> >      * 4.93 - The San Francisco community gets together to throw a bene=
fit
> > party for Malachy, who was seriously injured after the full moon party
> > early in March.
> >      * summer '93 - the South Bay lunch begins. I think the first one w=
as
> > at Jing Jing in Palo Alto, then it is agreed that it works better as a
> > bring-yr-food picnic in Greer Park.
> >      * 7.29.93 - I take over the SFR calendar from Brian.
> >      * 9.5.93 - Liquid Grooves at Crissy Field in San Francisco. This
> > started a string of Liquid Air parties, leading up to the first Friends
> > and Family at the Blue Cube. The original group of Liquid Air DJs inclu=
ded
> > Ethan, Bryce, Tamara Palmer, Jon Drukman, Lee An, and Laura La Gassa.
> >      * 10.3.93 - Lee F., along with Ethan and Bryce throw Connection Ea=
rth,
> > an SFR-sponsored party at Marx Meadows in Golden Gate Park.
> >
> > Other highlights: Your Sisters' House, Boogie Buffet, Together, Zanziba=
r,
> > Mission Rock, Groove Kitchen, MESS, Fluid Groove
> > 1994
> >
> >      * 1.15.94 - the first Friends and Family goes off in the Blue Cube=
.
> > Ethan, Bryce and the F&F collective pull it all together after learning
> > the ropes with fluid groove and liquid air. Subsequent F&F's pack Klub
> > Komotion with a hot & sweaty group of revelers.
> >      * 5.28.94 - Lee F. takes the lead in the SFR-organized party "In t=
he
> > Light" at the bandshell in Golden Gate Park.
> >      * 7.94 - Hyperreal comes up and SFR is moved to it.
> >
> > Other highlights: Sunset, Pure Space, Organic
> > 1995: SFR: Friends & Family
> >
> >      * 3.95 - The SFR Calendar goes up on the web
> >      * 3.95 - Thanks to the Zippies, SFR has a record 1080 messages ove=
r
> > the month.
> >      * 8.95 - Friends and Family outgrows Komotion and produces the fir=
st
> > of two stellar parties in an Oakland warehouse. The F&F Collective grow=
s
> > to many dozen people. The first is so wildly successful that 600 ticket=
s
> > for the next F&F sell out in advance, in one weekend.
> >      * 9.16.95 - Net.ravers from across the country gather and celebrat=
e
> > Brian and Laura's wedding with a pre-party at Bonny Doon Beach. They ar=
e
> > married the next day.
> >
> > Other highlights: Sunset, Simply Done, the Gardening Club, Frequency 8,
> > Area 51.
> > 1999: SFR: Best Local Online Rave Resource
> > SFR
> >
> >      * .99 - SF Raves won the SF Bay Guardian Best Of The Bay 1999 Awar=
d
> > for Best Local Online Rave Resource!
> >
> > 2000: SFR Keeps Going Till the End of the 20th Century
> >
> >      * 3.00 - SFR 8 Years in the Mix - D.O.B. March 1992
> >
> > 2001: SFR Keep's On Thumpin Into the 21st Century
> >
> >      * 1.01 - SF Raves is 9 years Old, in the Mix
> >      * 4.07.01 Epiphany - Ponies and Stuff
> >      * 4.26.01 - SF Raves throws Relic - a party to Remember
> >      * 5.01 - SF Raves' server taz, is retired, new and improved
> > taz3.hyperreal.org is born
> >      * 5.05.01 - SFRavers gather for a house party called Mexicon
> >      * 5.12.01 - Free Beats Throws a Notable Renegade Party in Berkeley=
, CA
> >      * 5.17.01 - Oxygen - A bi-weekly Party at the Oxygen Bar, leaves m=
any
> > fond memories in the mind of Karina
> >      * 5.22.01 - SF Ravers Justin Hale and Michael Liu throw a fabulous
> > party in the South Bay Called Secret Society
> >      * 6.16.01 - Fond Memories of Parties in GGP
> >      * 6.16.01 - Sf Ravers from Butterzone.net throw a fond weekly shin=
dig
> > called Sunday of Slack
> >      * 6.28.01 - Local Collective Epiphany has a three year anniversary
> > party
> >      * 7.07.01 - Eklektic makes its mark as a place for Junglists
> >
> > 2002: SFRaves Celebrates its Decade Anniversary
> > # SFR-P throws Amalagamation
> > # 09.29.02 -
> > SFRaves 10 YEAR ANNIVERSARY!
> > A Decade of SFRaves !!! - FREE OUTDOOR PARTY in the Park !!!
> > *** SFRaves History: SFRaves 10 Year Archives ****
> > Bringing the SFR Community an unforgettable day in the Sun, to enjoy an=
d
> > celebrate a decade of Music, Dance, Friendship and experiences of SFRav=
es
> > over the past 10 years. Experience the celebration through the expressi=
on
> > of ecclectic sound, intriguing memoires and a diverse memorabilia of
> > flyers, music, art and dance of spanning 1992 - 2002. Sound provided by
> > Neuroscience Creations.
> > Your lineup is as follows:
> >
> >      * Brian Behlendorf (SFRAVES, Connection, Hyperreal.org)
> >      * Ethan (Friends and Family) [www.bass-station.com/FnF]
> >      * Galen/Solar (Sunset/Pacific)
> >      * AndyW & Li [on 4 decks] (Viberation, Resource Records)
> > [www.viberation.com]
> >      * Amber & Drag'nfly [on 4 decks] (Sister, DNA, sfr-p, Teknique,
> > Epiphany) [www.iamthedj.com] (Amber) & [www.djdragnfly.com]
> >      * DJ2 (Moksha Tribe, Live Funk/Electro/Acid performance (Drag'nfly=
)
> >
> > This event is ALL AGES AND FREE!!! Free refreshments and snacks. 12pm-6=
pm
> > @ the beautiful McLaren Amphitheater, in San Francisco, CA
> > * Map and Directions: http://members.aol.com/peyote4000/map.htm
> > * Infolines: 415.564.4768 or 415.789.8236 **http://www.sfraves.org**
> > # SFR Calendar is redesigned and a new Hyperreal/SFR interface for the
> > calendar are launched.
> > SFRaves/Hyperreal Rave Interface includes
> >
> > SFR Calendar
> >
> > Calendar
> >
> > Groups
> >
> > People profiles
> >
> > Polls
> >
> > 2003
> >
> >      * SFRaves/Hyperreal Rave Interface grows in functionality, people =
and
> > size. The SFR Calendar is enhanced with multiple features. Features are
> > updated to include enhancements in the Events Calendar, Event Calendar
> > Interface, Groups, User/People profiles, Polls
> >      * SFRaves continues to grow at 11 years of age.
> >
> > 2004
> >
> >      * SFRaves/Hyperreal Rave Interface reaches the 1.0 milestone. SFR
> > calendar features continue enhancement and shift direction to broaden
> > scope and improved Quality standards.
> >      * Updated features: Events Calendar, Event calendar Groups,
> > User/People profiles
> >      * User Registration has skyrocketed to 258 groups and 1666 people =
as
> > of September 2004!
> >      * SFRaves has joined the Networking revolution: SFRaves @
> > Livejournal.com, SFRaves @ Tribe.net, SFRaves @ Friendster.com, SFRaves
> > Myspace Group and SFRaves @ Myspace, and SFRaves @ Orkut.com
> >      * SFRaves serves the community for 12 years strong!
> >
> > 2005
> >
> >      * SFRaves Calendar continues to grow in reach, registration of Use=
rs,
> > Groups and features.
> >      * SFRaves becomes a teenager in 2005! 13 years and counting...
> >      * SFRaves continues branches out and networks nonstop. The communi=
ty
> > has grown by leaps and bounds to include direct networking connections =
on
> > various sites on the web. As a result, both the user base and the bread=
th
> > of our community has an extended reach and continues to grow.
> >      * SFRaves Calendar User Registration has skyrocketed to 310 groups=
 and
> > 1985 people as of January 2005!
> >      * SFRaves Network Contacts: SFRaves @ Livejournal.com, SFRaves @
> > Tribe.net, SFRaves @ Friendster.com, SFRaves Myspace Group, SFRaves @
> > Myspace and SFRaves @ Orkut.com
> >      * SFRaves serves the community for 13 years strong!

> Erm, maybe. IMO, though:
> 
> NIN != sexy. I thought they were before I'd ever
> even had sex, but now
> they just seem a little contrived. Possible
> exception: "Reptile".
> 
> Chemical Brothers != sexy. Tom and Ed are just too
> nerdy to make sexy
> music, period.
> 
> The Prodigy != sexy. They just all seem like a bunch
> of tweakers to me,
> and their music reflects that. Some stuff on Jilted
> might be deep enough
> for getting down, but I can't say I'd ever put their
> CD on if I were
> expecting to get laid.
> 
> Here are some suggestions off the top of my head:
> 
> Aeroc - Viscous Solid (made entirely from sampled
> acoustic guitars)
> Cylob - Cylobian Sunset (classic ambient/IDM)
> FSOL - Lifeforms (no embellishment necessary))
> Fabric 12 - The Amalgamation Of Soundz (great
> progression!)
> Herbert - Around the House (deep, sexy click-house)
> Massive Attack - No Protection (dub mixes by Mad
> Professor)
> Nightmares on Wax - Carboot Soul (dubbed out vocal
> trip-hop)
> Peter Kruder - Peace Orchestra (ultra-deep
> dischordant sex music)
> Thomas Fehlmann - Lowflow (deep, dubby houseno)
> 
> Cheers,

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  DIRTY w/ Future Funk Squad - Feb. 19th - 330 Ritch

Evil Breaks presents...

DIRTY
Saturday, February 19th
@ 330 Ritch, SF
2 rooms a'rockin'
9pm - 3am
$7 b4 11 / $10 after

Yeah you heard that right. DIRTY is back and comin at you with some 
nastiness. Come check out our new monthly venue that we'll be sharing with 
Subscience.  For our first night, we've got some wicked breaks and dirty 
techno.  Come to get down.

Featuring:
FUTURE FUNK SQUAD
(Functional breaks/Island/En:vision/Default/Cryptic) - UK
This man needs no introduction.  Making beats since 1999, Future Funk Squad 
has produced a consistent stream of breakbeat stormers and remixed the likes 
of Moloko, Stanton Warriors and Koma+Bones.  With over 10 years of DJing 
experience, he will do the unthinkably nasty to your earholes!

Breakbeat Extravaganza:
Smoove (Space Cowboys/Newsbreakz/Opel) - Nitevibe Dreamteam 2005
Aaron Jae vs. Bam (Evil Breaks/AaronJae.com/Invibe)
M.O.D. vs. Influence (Evil Breaks/In tha Mix)
Marco (*thwap!*/substructure)

Techno Delights:
Forest Green (SisterSF/Dim Sum/Forestgreen.org)
Andy W (Resource Records/Viberation)
Juan Segovia (Hugger-Mugger/tech-on)
Gamma vs. Mek (Techno-truth/Stilldream)

9pm - 3am
@ 330 Ritch
$7 before 11pm and only $10 after that, so get there early.

--------------------------
< Brandon / DJ Bam >

http://www.invibe.com/bam

quoth Brandon S.:
> Lorin is going to tear Migs and Farina new assholes.  as good as they
> are, they play mellow shit.  Lorin will destroy that place with breaks
> and hip hop.  he will also put way more energy into his set than both
> of them combined.

I would've agreed with you if I hadn't seen Farina tear it up last time
I saw him (w/Derrick Carter at Mezzanine). You'd be amazed how well a
couple of cleverly placed Solid Groove remixes work to spice up a
relatively tame house set.

Gotta say it though: Ruby Skye really sucks. I went there to see Danny
Tenaglia a couple of weeks ago and it was just horrible. Not only did
the crowd suck, but Tenaglia was such a disappointment. I'm not planning
on going back there for a looooong time.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: sex music

Sometimes NIN can be good.. especially if its ex-sex.  For the hard edge
though I prefer Lords of Acid/Praga Khan.

My top 3 albums in no particular order:

Freaky Chakra - Blacklight Fantasy (really deep, sweaty music.. the kind
of music that reminds you of summer nights where its too hot to sleep with
no chance of cooling off so why not get hotter)

Astralasia  - 7-Pointed Star  (fast fantasy dreamscape)

Kruder and Dorfmeister -  The K&D Sessions, but really anything by them as
well. I mean that is pretty much why they make music. :)

-Rayn

> quoth CHUCK G:
>> How about for a soundtrack during
>> wicked-evil-kinky-right-now-I'm-on-(fill in your favorite eh-hum here)
>> sex?
>
> Erm, maybe. IMO, though:
>
> NIN != sexy. I thought they were before I'd ever even had sex, but now
> they just seem a little contrived. Possible exception: "Reptile".
>
> Chemical Brothers != sexy. Tom and Ed are just too nerdy to make sexy
> music, period.
>
> The Prodigy != sexy. They just all seem like a bunch of tweakers to me,
> and their music reflects that. Some stuff on Jilted might be deep enough
> for getting down, but I can't say I'd ever put their CD on if I were
> expecting to get laid.
>
> Here are some suggestions off the top of my head:
>
> Aeroc - Viscous Solid (made entirely from sampled acoustic guitars)
> Cylob - Cylobian Sunset (classic ambient/IDM)
> FSOL - Lifeforms (no embellishment necessary))
> Fabric 12 - The Amalgamation Of Soundz (great progression!)
> Herbert - Around the House (deep, sexy click-house)
> Massive Attack - No Protection (dub mixes by Mad Professor)
> Nightmares on Wax - Carboot Soul (dubbed out vocal trip-hop)
> Peter Kruder - Peace Orchestra (ultra-deep dischordant sex music)
> Thomas Fehlmann - Lowflow (deep, dubby houseno)
>
> Cheers,
> --

hello, this is a continuation of a fictional piece:
 
"are you going to watch the football game, ig?"
 
"i don't know. are you, supa?"
 
"probably. it is a cool thing to do."
 
"i am not very cool, supa, you know that, don't you."
 
"i think your cool, ig."
 
"well, your the only one."
 
"i saw that girl checking you out when we were on our way to the store."
 
"that was very strange wasn't it?"
 
"yes, strange and rare." :)

were lowkey in comparison.

quiclk...

Subject: [sfraves] SFRaves dinners

I've organized dinners for impromptu get togethers for SFRaves members 
before, and am interested in having more to throw down the Peace, Love, 
Unity and Respect for SFRavers. Any takers?

Depending on interest and availability - time, date, place TBD

I try and schedule dinners in various locales (SC, South Bay, Ebay, NoBay, 
SF, Peninsula, et al) so that a reach is created in each area. It's a fun 
way for people to get together between events, a way to gather a community 
presence in person, and get to know your fellow Community members outside 
the virtual arena.

If interested, please respond here, or alternative you can contact me via 
karina@hyperreal.org or / YIM/AIM (located in my Member profile)

Much love to you!

--

let's see here, if i'm limited to djs that post on here regularly, then here 
we go.  in no particular order:

stickman - have seen him spin multiple genres and spin them well
andyw - techno, sure...but also known for moments of leftfield genius
indigo - funky and groovy and bouncy
marco - for his skill, probably the most underbooked dj i know on this list
andrew phelan - house music all night long
chris jackson - machine
koroma - tribal, techy and bangin
drag'nfly - never heard a bad set from this woman

where the hell are the dnb djs on this list? also a lack of progressive 
house djs and hardly any trance (yes, i like trance sometimes so fuck off).

Subject: [sfraves] SRR > Looking for new tennats for :  live-in lofts,  Electonica Music Culture Studios, New or Recovering business incubator 

Over the next few months, We will be taking over leases, purchasing vacant
spaces etc, in San Francisco, Oakland and San Jose . The plan is to acquire
multi story buildings. The upper levels will be live/work lofts. The lower
levels will be for business incubator space for new or recovering business,
or non profits that are more grateful to have a space rather than have gold
door handles and marble floors! The locations will also hold several "Fund
Raiser" style events in the musical arts genre each month. Flexible tenants
are a  must. More information to follow. I am just getting the word out to
see who may be interested, how much you are able to afford monthly, the
amount of space needed etc. We are looking to offer to VoIP (Voice over IP)
to all of our tenants, as it will also me a beta test for one of our
services soon to launch/go public.

If you are interested, please email me privately. I would love to get your
opinions. needs etc. assembled so the proper building will be acquired ;-) 

Also, we are needing 1099 independent and experienced technology sales reps.
We are also taking applications for field IT Technicians. 

If you are failure with desktop support, helpdesk etc. 

Any or all of the following a major plus MCSE, MCP, A+, Linux/Unix Jr.
Level, CCIE, CCNE, CCNA, Please visit www.HawkRidgeTech.com 


Take care,
matt
www.HawkRidgeTech.com

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


___________________________________________________________________

1.   DISCIPLINARY HEARING AGAINST KELLY'S MISSION ROCK

Last week, two days of hearings were conducted at the Entertainment 
Commission on a Suspension/Revocation action brought by the San Francisco 
Police Department against the Kelly's Mission Rock (KMR) entertainment 
venue.  The Police Department alleges that KMR operations have created an 
ongoing nuisance in the neighborhood, involving excessive noise, fights and 
auto sideshows.  The first two days of the hearing primarily involved the 
City presenting nuisance charges against KMR, with cross examination of 
witnesses by KMR attorneys.  Testimony was presented by Bayview police 
officers as well as neighbors.  The defense had begun to make its case when 
the second day of testimony was adjourned.

The hearing will continue on Feb. 22 at 5pm at the Entertainment Commission 
in Room 406 of City Hall.  These hearings are open to the public.

This is the first disciplinary hearing adjudicated by the Entertainment 
Commission since its formation in 2003.  Prior to the formation of the 
Entertainment Commission, the San Francisco Police Department both brought 
charges and conducted disciplinary hearings against permitted venues.  One 
of the reasons for the creation of the Entertainment Commission was to 
eliminate this potential conflict of interest.  Under the current system, 
the charges are being brought by the Police Department but are being heard 
by the Entertainment Commission, which is an independent body with 
representatives of the entertainment industry, neighbor groups, public 
health, law enforcement and city planning.

Stay tuned for ongoing updates on the disciplinary hearings on Kelly's 
Mission 
Rock. 
<http://sflnc.com/index/readthis/news/Mission_Rock/>http://sflnc.com/index/readthis/news/Mission_Rock/


2  "TURNING THE TIDE" AN LGBT BENEFIT FOR TSUNAMI RELIEF

The SFLNC is joining up with groups from the LGBT community to help raise 
funds for Tsunami disaster relief.  This event will take place on Saturday, 
Feb. 5th from 8pm to 4am at Terra, 511 Harrison St. in San Francisco.  The 
night will feature an art sale, a live/silent auction, food, drinks, 
cabaret acts and DJs, including DJ Pusspuss and Liam Shy from the SFLNC.

Check out the flyer and full line-up at 
<http://www.queercares.com/>http://www.queercares.com/.

START SOMA + local artist Tim Gaskin have put together a very special art 
show in conjunction with this benefit. Basically, they have created a giant 
16,000 square foot ART MARKET, similar to the exhibition organized for 
their successful SFLNC fundraiser last year.  Over fifty artists. LOTS of 
great art at great prices. Participating artists get half of all art sales. 
The other half goes to the Rainbow World Fund.  The art show will be open 
from 8pm-12 midnight.

All proceeds from this event will go directly to CARE International via the 
Rainbow World Fund (www.rainbowfund.org).

Tickets are only $10 at the door so come on out, have a great time and help 
with the ongoing tsunami relief effort


3. HELP SAVE THE HARDING THEATER

The Harding Theatre, the last remaining theater on Divisadero Street and 
one of the City's best preserved neighborhood theaters is threatened with 
demolition.  The Harding was operated as a church for many years but was 
sold to a developer who now plans to demolish the theater.  The Harding 
opened in 1926 and was designed by the Reid Brothers, a prominent San 
Francisco architectural firm that also designed the Fairmont Hotel.  The 
Harding has served the community as a neighborhood movie theater, a live 
theater, a music venue and most recently as a church.

Unfortunately, during the Harding's years as a church the exterior of the 
theater fell into disrepair and as a result most people have no idea that a 
beautiful theater remains intact inside.   According the the SF Bay 
Guardian 
(<http://www.sfbg.com/39/18/x_biznews.html>http://www.sfbg.com/39/18/x_biznews.html), 
the SF Planning Department approved the demolition permit without 
inspection based on developer claims that the historic elements had been 
removed.  Neighborhood activists instead have presented photos showing the 
interior to be mostly intact.

The Harding Theater is also right next to the Independent Music venue, so 
it is inevitable that the construction of condos next to a major music 
venue will threaten the Independent.  A coalition of local business owners 
have proposed preserving the theater and turning it into an arts, theater 
and entertainment complex. The SFLNC supports the construction of 
additional housing, but this must be done with proper planning.  Approving 
the demolition of a historic theater to build condos in a neighborhood 
commercial district next to an existing entertainment venue is a huge 
mistake by the SF planning department that should be opposed.  For more 
info on how to save the Harding Theater, go to 
<http://sflnc.com/index/readthis/news/harding_theatre/>http://sflnc.com/index/readthis/news/harding_theatre/

4. Please join the SFLNC and help us continue our work on behalf of San 
Francisco Nightlife 
<http://sflnc.com/index/donate/>http://sflnc.com/index/donate/




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands 
of the bosses and their employers, the special interests.  An invisible 
empire has been set up above the forms of democracy."
-Woodrow Wilson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

So class ended, went 2 hang out w/ Bam 4 a few, gave him a gift, talk talk
gossip talk talk, then i walked over 2 ANU!!!

OK.. WOW!!  It was jumpin' as soon as I was like w/in the out
peremitters.. WOW!!  dope.. I saw Harry who i ain't seenin like almost a
year.. DOPE!!!  I walk in.. CROWDED!!!  Made my way 2 the dancefloor..
PrOgGy HoUsE.. YUM!!!  Looked @ the DJ behind the decks!!  It was birthday
boy WIL!!!   YAY!!!

The crowd @ Anu lastnight was WOW... mondo energy!!  I mean.. honestly..
it was a mondo sausagefest w/ the ratio bein' 1 Chica 2 every 6 guys...
but it was a nice, really Groovin' crowd (considering the frat party
pressence... LoL)

So what would a Groovy night @ some hole in the wall be w/o seein' some
famil faces, ya know???  So getting back 2 like Qool happy hour... Anu
seemed 2 b filled w/ a spill over of people who came from there... so I
saw Koroma, dragnfly, oh gosh... who else... I dunno.. alota random people
I can't remember right now.. oh oh oh.. JC was there!!  YAY!!  OK.. I know
there wre like more people there that I shoulda remembered...

But Wil was Dope!!!  I mean.. he totally spun a Groovy Proggy HOuse set
that I Loved!!!  Then like not 2 far in 2 the next DJ, LoL, siad my byes,
Hello 2day, then Koroma took me home!!! (Dude, THAAAAAAAANK U SOOOOO MUCH
AGAIN MAN]

But all in all Anu was Jumpin' 4 a Wed night!!  LoL.. Dope!


-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:  Doctor recommendations?  - Kaiser

--0-1166025552-1107545894=:54036
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Hey Buddy,
 
I work for a company that actually pays for Kaiser as a perk. . . It sucks- worst health "care" ever. I wound up paying extra to get a PPO. If I couldn't afford a PPO, I'd go to a public clinic before I went back to Kaiser. And forget about that "primary" physician crap, you'll see them once or twice a year, maybe; if you're deathly ill, and lucky. 
 
If you're stuck with Kaiser, I advise you find a primary physician that practices in a satellite office- away from any of their main campuses or hospitals. I notice that a lot of their physicians have good credentials (i.e. Stanford, Berkeley, etc.), but like I said, actually getting in to see one is the trick. 
 
Oh yeah- one last note- when you're sick, they always make you talk to an "advice nurse" before you can come in. The A.N.'s are only there to tell you to gurgle on salt water when you have a sore throat & to get rest. IGNORE THEM & DEMAND AN APPOINTMENT. Dealing with an HMO is like dealing with SBC, except your health is on the line instead of some phone bill they fucked up.
 
Happy, Happy. 
 
peace
 
Chuck

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:  Doctor recommendations?  - Kaiser

kaiser is a humongous organization.

and although i've heard many reports like mr. G's, there are some great
doctors for kaiser.

i've never had a problem scheduling a visit w/ my primary physician.  i
have to wait a few weeks but not a problem to get an appointment.

urgent care is available in most areas until about 8:30pm.  i've never
spoken to an advice nurse.

i'm not saying mr. G is wrong.  i'm saying i've had other experiences.

Jonas




> Hey Buddy,
>
> I work for a company that actually pays for Kaiser as a perk. . . It
> sucks- worst health "care" ever. I wound up paying extra to get a PPO. If
> I couldn't afford a PPO, I'd go to a public clinic before I went back to
> Kaiser. And forget about that "primary" physician crap, you'll see them
> once or twice a year, maybe; if you're deathly ill, and lucky.
>
> If you're stuck with Kaiser, I advise you find a primary physician that
> practices in a satellite office- away from any of their main campuses or
> hospitals. I notice that a lot of their physicians have good credentials
> (i.e. Stanford, Berkeley, etc.), but like I said, actually getting in to
> see one is the trick.
>
> Oh yeah- one last note- when you're sick, they always make you talk to an
> "advice nurse" before you can come in. The A.N.'s are only there to tell
> you to gurgle on salt water when you have a sore throat & to get rest.
> IGNORE THEM & DEMAND AN APPOINTMENT. Dealing with an HMO is like dealing
> with SBC, except your health is on the line instead of some phone bill
> they fucked up.
>
> Happy, Happy.
>
> peace
>
> Chuck
>

Mime-Version: 1.0

In-Reply-To: <20050204210351.66479.qmail@web60809.mail.yahoo.com>
User-Agent: Mutt/1.3.28i
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:  Doctor recommendations?  - Kaiser



yeah, I have been with kaiser for a long time and I have no real complaints.
In my expereince, they seem to be very scared of getting sued, so they
seem to always take as many tests, ect as possible.  They won't tell
you to come in for checkups, but if you want one, they will give you one.

Different kaiser locations vary quite a bit.  For example, the SF campus
on Geary street I have always been happy with... while the Oakland location
does seem to suck.

-troy

Subject: [sfraves] nightmares and money nrr

--0-380515504-1107561983=:22043
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

hello,  this is a continuation of a fictional piece:
 
"AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!"
 
"wake up, ig. wake up."
 
"huh?"
 
"are you okay?"
 
"i was having a nightmare."
 
"what was your dream about?"
 
"well, in the dream, i had a sister, and my sister had a boyfriend, and the boyfriend was a total freak. he would copy my sister's way of speaking when talking with other people, because he thought people would like him better, but the whole time, he was a total loser, and i couldn't wake up. thanks, supa. i am glad it was just a dream."
 
"me too. maybe you should think about something else so that you will be able to sleep again."
 
"think about something else? like what?"
 
"how about investments."
 
"what kind of investments?"
 
"well, what do you think would be a good thing to invest in during the next few days."
 
"how about some hotdogs?"
 
"that is pretty good. with the game coming up, that is probably one of the most sound investments you would be able to make, ig. i am proud of you for noticing."
 
"i didn't notice anything other than my growling stomach." :)

of identity crisis.  i don't think so.  i know i'm more metro
than geigh.  the gay doods are all, "what's up with that?"  i'm
all, "i dunno.  i'm sorry..."

really stand out.  anyway, here they are:

At 04:52 PM 2/4/2005, you wrote:
>some people say i'm metro.  but i'm not.  i'm pretty geigh.
>but i like women.  not really the doods.  maybe it's some sort
>of identity crisis.  i don't think so.  i know i'm more metro
>than geigh.  the gay doods are all, "what's up with that?"  i'm
>all, "i dunno.  i'm sorry..."
>
>:(  <--- sad expression on my face

=-O  <----surprised expression on my face.  I guess you are wrestling with 
the term "metrosexual?"  If not, I'm completely lost here.

The term was invented by Mark Simpson, "Here come the mirror men," The 
Independent, November 15, 1994.  Then his 2002 Salon article threw is all 
over the place.


>but yeah, you know who's metro?  i know lots of metro doods.
>it's not like i'm outing them, because if you see 'em on the
>street, they stand out like a sore thumb.  well, that doesn't
>really stand out.  anyway, here they are:


Who is a metrosexual?  Mark Simpson in the 2002 Salon article cited above 
offers this definition:

"The typical metrosexual is a young man with money to spend, living in or 
within easy reach of a metropolis ­ because that's where all the best 
shops, clubs, gyms and hairdressers are. He might be officially gay, 
straight or bisexual, but this is utterly immaterial because he has clearly 
taken himself as his own love object and pleasure as his sexual preference. 
Particular professions, such as modeling, waiting tables, media, pop music 
and, nowadays, sport, seem to attract them but, truth be told, like male 
vanity products and herpes, they're pretty much everywhere.
­Mark Simpson, "Meet the metrosexual," Salon.com, July 22, 2002 "

What does it all mean? :-$  Freedom, I guess, for newly empowered urban men 
(hate that fuckin' term empowered) to use facial creams, hair products, and 
envelope themselves in Diesel, Prada and the like |-O  Much like the 
seventies, I guess.  But back then you knew the boys who used Vaseline...

Love,

Apollo




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands 
of the bosses and their employers, the special interests.  An invisible 
empire has been set up above the forms of democracy."
-Woodrow Wilson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_6697190==.ALT--

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  The Vice Lords of the Replacement Economies

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

The Vice Lords of the Replacement Economies

How the Drug War and the Prison-Industrial Complex connect in a vicious 
cycle of violence, vice, and profit.

by Charles Shaw
February 1, 2005

"In war, truth is the first casualty."
- Aeschylus



In the United States government's "War on Drugs", the rules are simple 
enough to grasp. Since drugs are bad for you, foster crime, and destroy 
people's lives, they are illegal, and those that are involved with them are 
criminals who belong in jail. In this paradigm, drug dealers are violent 
and dangerous, and despite the emergence of a recovery culture, addicts are 
still considered morally bankrupt "others". Removing these elements from 
the streets is generally considered a good thing, and whatever it takes to 
accomplish this, even if it means bending the Constitution, should be 
encouraged and permitted in the interest of our general safety and well being.

Every day Americans have these views reinforced by elected officials, the 
corporate media, and a pervading culture of addiction that is hardly 
limited to these denizens of society, but rather infiltrates millions of 
American lives. Everywhere you turn, people are warning you of the dangers 
of some drugs, while pushing others relentlessly. Everywhere you go, 
someone has a story of how addiction or violence ruined someone close to them.

And most people end up thinking , Isn't it wonderful of our Government to 
try and protect us.

MORE:  http://www.newtopiamagazine.net/content/issue20/features/vicelords.php




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands 
of the bosses and their employers, the special interests.  An invisible 
empire has been set up above the forms of democracy."
-Woodrow Wilson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_13298852==.ALT--

Subject: [sfraves] A Fine Hole


A Fine Hole

i.

Its too bad we like each other.

We people
its too bad we *like* so much.

We destroy ourselves.
Its too bad we dont keep each other around.


January 1991, for example:  
Mac popped out of the hatch of the tank.

That sandnigger didnt want no fight.
Hands held high to Iraqi skies,
But missing the point.

Mac opened up a fine hole in that sandnigger.

Mac understood--
We must destroy ourselves.

We cheered him--- Mac!  Our homecoming hero.
But we never mentioned the sandnigger.

That round was meant for piercing tanks,
But it made a fine hole.

It made a fine hole.


ii.

We peopleas twos:
We last nine months,
Or 84, if were lucky enough
To replicate and raise dumb monkeys like us.
 
We fuck, 
We birth invisible babies.
We dust away
Then We are dead.

Then you, then me
We dust apart.
We dust apart,

Apart.  Apart.
We dust apart.



=====

         a  m  b  i  e  n  t      m  a  f  i  a
of course, we've had it in the ear before.

Subject: [sfraves] NRR > Need people to beta test our new online 448bit encryption data storage client/server.

NRR > Need people to beta test our new online 448bit encryption data storage
client/server. 

What I am looking for is people/businesses to use our backup client/server,
u/l and archive offsite your pictures, personal works, mp3 or whatever you
desire. 

We are in final stages (pre-launch) and the marketing is just about to
begin. I would like user feedback on how easy the client setup is,
Configuration, 
usability etc. The service is geared more towards SOHO (Small Office / Home
Office) as the client is EXTREMLY ADVACNED and has many options
 that the average non-technical person may not completely grasp.

If you would like to be part of the pilot program, please email me privately
the following information :

1. username
2. password (Minimum 8 characters)
3. your full name, address, phone numbers (This info is needed in order to
send you a restore CD's, DVD's, USB Hard Drive)
4. The amount of space you need (In giga bites)
5. Your internet upload / download connection speed (You can get this info
from www.SpeedTest.com)

The current client only runs on Microsoft at this time. Future
Mac/Unix/Linux clients will be available in the coming months.

We currently have active the following levels of encryption enabled : 

Secure Blowfish
Triple DES
DES

Thanks in advance,
Matt
www.HawkRidgeTech.com

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] art in Bagdad

they say suffering gives birth to the best works of
art.  

The paintbrush is mightier than the M60-A1 with
depleted uranium armor-piercing shells.  Or something.

booms
.................
http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/4229377.stm

  Baghdad's blast wall art
  By Roger Hearing


  In a dull Baghdad world of concrete and razor-wire,
chicanes and blast barriers, a little colour has just
re-appeared.

  Every official building or media base these days has
a frontage of four-metre (13ft) high concrete walls to
protect against bombs and 
mortars, but Iraqis have begun to see the grey expanse
as a public canvas.

  There is of course graffiti, but mostly great
swirling apolitical exuberance - everything from
retro-Chagall to prog-rock album-cover teenage
fantasies.

  Outside the French embassy, just two doors down from
the BBC bureau, there is a profusion of images - wild
horses, flying carpets, impossible towers and
minarets, as well as a simple scene of an Iraqi farmer
in a tractor coming back to his wife and children at
the close of the day.

  On almost every section there is a dove - the symbol
of a peace Iraqis do not yet know.

  Academic approach

The Reuters news agency's building has a pattern of
flowers and Iraqi flags, and next door has some
attempts at what seems to be vaguely-remembered
Picassos.

  And the BBC's house? Well I have to say, it is
impressive.

  A professor of fine art was called in, I was told,
and he produced, over many weeks, an elaborate tribute
to the ancient history of his people across the
fortifications of our building.

  Angular, bearded Assyrian heads mingle with Sumerian
ziggurats, Babylonian chariots and visions of rulers
and wars long past - perhaps 
an aide-memoire that this country has been through
difficult times before. And survived.

  Elsewhere in the city, security means glimpses of
the art generally have to be snatched through
curtained windows of our minivan - but the 
pattern of current popular expression all over Baghdad
seems to be much the same - history or fantasy.

  Saddam's many guises

As long as I have been coming here, there has been
plenty of public art. In the past, however, there was
one subject - Saddam Hussein.

  Saddam in many guises - as Western playboy, as Arab
sheikh, even on one occasion as a Kremlin communist
complete with fur hat, but always 
Saddam, displayed on huge hoardings around the city
squares.

  And always depicted in the heroic socialist-realism
style dictators seem to favour.

  They have all gone of course, and with them any
feeling of artistic restriction, apparently.

  All is possible now it seems - even if the blast
walls that have become the artists' gallery are things
most Iraqis would sooner be without.

So there was like this Disco Diva Vocal House music playing @ White Horse
& like all these gay Dudes like danicing around w/ all these branding
irons in there hands & all these animals in the club.. it was kinda freaky
'cause like well... they were branding every kinda animal in the club...
the horses, chickens, there was a pissed off tied up bull in the corner
that had like 7-8 happy faces branded on it...  It was ummm..
interesting...

So Dina went off 2 dance w/ some gay boys onthe dance floor & me & Terri
got Cokes @ the bar & walked around... then we ended up in a line to heat
up our branding irons 2 mark an animal... it was weird... but yeah... I
ened up branding a pig & Terri ended up branding a Zebra!!!  I dunno.. I
felt so weird like after that just holding that iron thingie, so I gave it
back 2 the scary farmer dude & Terri did also!  then we joined Dina on the
Dancefloor & we all boogied down 2 that "Electric Avenue" remake song...
it was fun!!

We were like dancing 4 a few more minutes, then the doors busted open &
these Cops appeared w/ guns & stuff!!!  As soon as they walked in, ALL the
animals ran out of the club!!  Luckily, earlier Dina threw her iron across
the club when she accidentally branded some Italian Hella Tall Beau Hunk's
ass which kinda caused that Italian dude 2 throw his iron also.  So we
grabbed Dina & the Tall Italian Beau Hunk & we casually looked like we
were walking to the bar even though the police told us 2 stand still! Then
while the police were turned around.. we tip toes reeeeeeally fast to the
door & ran to the car!!

It was kinda a hard run 'cause well... Terri was wearing red & the red was
pissin' the bull off (OHMYGOODNESS, OH MY GOSH, HELLO 2DAY, REDBULL, I get
it now!) so she had 2 run around the block w/ a few other animals to lose
the bull while we waited in the car...

"Oh Shit.. we still have to get our Burgers Dina!!!" I yelled as I ran out
the cars 2 the burger joint & got our food!!  Then I hoped back in the
back seat  of the car & Dina started driving around the block looking for
Terri & the Tell Italian Beau Hunk... we saw them & they ran up & hopped
in the car... the Bull wasn't too far from them, & we drove off!!  We were
drivin' down Ashby & there were still alota animals running...

We finally got 2 the the 80 enter freeway road thingie & drove all the way
strait up....

"Osby..." Terri began 2 say "... I think we sould just all head out 2
Dina's Mom boat house in Crockett & we'll bring U home 2morrow!  I think
we all need 2 like totally chill out from all that shit we just been
through, ya know?"

"Yeah, I was gonna say same thing Terri!!" I said.

"Aawzbiiie is jer nam?" the Tall Italian Beau Hunk started to say to me!

"Yeah dude... what's your name man?" I asked as we shook hands!

"Antonio!" he said.  "Me anglais is eeeh, not good."

"Naw man.. it all Groovy man!  So U don't mind hangin' out w/ us crazy
people?  Ummm... do you know what 'Ravers' are?" I asked.

"No, me glad to be wiv you peple!" he said as I felt this strong squeeze
on my thigh!!!

"HELLO 2DAY!!!" I shouldted as every1 in the Divafly mobile started laughing!

We got 2 the boathouse in crockett & went inside!!  We all sat in the
kitchen w/ the burgers &, fries & drinks.  then Terri Looked in the
fridge.

"Uuuuuh, guys, are we like really that hungry???  There's hella CRAB in
here!" Terri Said!

So we feasted on Burgers, Fries, & Crab while the Antonio gave us a strip
show to 1 of Dina's CDs her Mom had on the boat!

We all went 2 sleep & woke up around around 2-3!  they drove me home
shortly after that w/ Antonio & they came insode the house w/ me 'cause
Terri hd to go use the bathroom!

The 1st thing my mom said when she saw me was, "Howcome you have chicken
feathers in your hair?"

--THE END--

Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

> burger joint.. let's eat, my treat!"  So we went 2 the burger place &

> drunk.
> i got my newly turned 21 friend leslie drunk.  some dude kept hitting on
> her
> and asked me if she was single.  that dude was moshen, who became a good
> friend of mine.  that night, i met Tim and Eva for the first time.  we all
> went out for food afterwards.  Tim and Eva recently got married and are
> now
> my housemates.
>
> 3)  the night i met Veanne.  it was outside 550.  i danced.  she called me
> a
> "fucking raver" and laughed at me.  and i thought to myself "damn, i hope
> i
> run into this girl again."
>
>
>
> --------------------------
> < Brandon / DJ Bam >
>

> http://www.invibe.com/bam

Subject: [sfraves] Ethiopan Capital Celebrates Bob Marley's Birthday
