>>>>> >techno and electro party at Cellspace last year, the Droid Behavior 
>>>>> >guys
>>>>> >who came up for the party complained that we weren't "techno enough". 
>>>>> >I
>>>>> >want to do parties the way I like them, but I want to make the people 
>>>>> > >who
>>>>> >attend happy too.  This may be an impossibility, as we're not quite
>>>>> >"techno enough" for techno kids I guess.
>>>>> >
>>>>> >Alien Autopsy satisfied all the usual techno party requirements. 
>>>>> >Dark;
>>>>> >check. Hard; check. Spooky and evil; check. Anoraks; well, I didn't 
>>>>> >see
>>>>> >any, but I'm sure there must have been an anorak or two being worn 
>>>>> >there
>>>>> >somewhere.  And I did notice a few bald guys.  Maybe techno ravers 
>>>>> >don't
>>>>> >want their party formula to be messed with.  It seems to me that this 
>>>>> >is
>>>>> >how they like it.  There was no question of this party not being 
>>>>> >"techno
>>>>> >enough".  It had all the bases covered, and people loved it.
>>>>> >
>>>>> >There are so many different facets of the SF techno scene, lots of > 
>>>>> >little
>>>>> >micro-scenes. I would love to see the scene become more united, but 
>>>>> >the
>>>>> >problem with techno snobs is that they get so into their thing that 
>>>>> >they
>>>>> >have a hard time looking beyond their own subgenre oriented 
>>>>> >microscene.
>>>>> >
>>>>> >Maybe this is a bad analogy, but I see it like this--  The Democratic
>>>>> >party has become increasingly weak because of all the squabbling and
>>>>> >divisions within the party, whereas the Republican party is much more
>>>>> >united and unfortunately has become a lot stronger than the Democrats
>>>>> >because of their unity and passion.  Despite the lack of quality in 
>>>>> >the
>>>>> >trance scene, the enthusiasm and unity found in the candy kid world 
>>>>> >has
>>>>> >kept the trance scene alive and strong long after we've all declared 
>>>>> >it
>>>>> >dead several times. SF's techno scene, like the Democrats, will never 
>>>>> >be
>>>>> >strong if we continue to be divided along sub-genre lines. 
>>>>> >Furthermore,
>>>>> >your average techno fan now, after seeing their music be ignored by 
>>>>> >most
>>>>> >rave promoters and regularly get confused with trance, has become 
>>>>> >jaded
>>>>> >and apathetic.  If we are divided, jaded, and apathetic, techno will 
>>>>> >be
>>>>> >going nowhere fast!
>>>>> >
>>>>> >I want to see anorak-wearing minimal guys dancing to funky techno! I 
>>>>> > >want
>>>>> >nosebleed schranz DJs to start buying electro records!  I want to see
>>>>> >people support the techno scene with enthusiasm and passion! And I 
>>>>> >have >no
>>>>> >problem with hearing janky piano riffs in techno tracks!
>>>>> >
>>>>> >Perhaps you have been slightly dissapointed with recent techno 
>>>>>events, > >but
>>>>> >things are changing.  This is going to be our year.  ;)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Reviews: DJ Hell, Alien Autopsy, Dirty, and another brief rant

Thanks man, I dig it.  Answers.com also noted that anorak can be used as a 
slang word:

anorak (slang)
In British slang, anorak has come to mean "geek" or "nerd", originally from 
the use of anoraks as the invariable wear of train spotters, and then by 
extension to refer to anyone with an unfathomable interest in detailed 
information regarded as boring by the rest of the population - aided by the 
intuition that only a geek would wear something so terminally unfashionable.

The word can be qualified by the area in which the person takes an (implied) 
excessive interest; for example in education, a "timetabling anorak" would 
be someone who found the process of timetabling classes fascinating.

It was reportedly derived from the weatherproof upper clothing worn by 
enthusiasts of offshore radio who would, despite their lack of familiarity 
with maritime life, sometimes travel from British ports in small boats to 
visit the ships from which their outcast heroes broadcast during the 1967-76 
period. The collective impression of their brightly coloured garments in the 
coastal murk of the North Sea was presumably memorable to the crews of those 
"pirate ships" who had restricted contact with the mainland due to the 
Marine Broadcasting Offences Act and the visits might have had an important 
morale-boosting role, although the wearers of the garments might often have 
regretted the discomfort of those sea-tossed journeys. In rough weather 
presumably the anoraks were far more apparent than their distressed wearers 
so those people were identified just by the name of their outer garments. 
The term was reportedly coined by Andy Archer, a disc jockey who gained fame 
in the period following the passing of that Act by the government of Harold 
Wilson. The usage then become generalised to mean obsessive enthusiasts of 
any outdoor activity, and later to cover enthusiasts of other unfashionable 
activities too.

>>>>According to the book "Last Night a DJ Save My Life" by Bill Brewster 
>>>>and Frank Broughton the "costume" of Northern soul was: "...high-waisted 
>>>>pleated trousers with wide flapping legs known as 'Brummie bags,' 
>>>>bowling shirts, singlets, or Ben Shermans, white socks, flat leather 
>>>>soled shoes, and an Adidas or Gola sports bag..."  I don't think any of 
>>>>those things are Anorak's.  Incidentally I am not entirely sure what the 
>>>>word Anorak means.  Doubt that really added anything to this discussion,

>I for one am actually shocked that the techno & breaks heads got
together on 
a party judging by how little most techno-heads tend to like breaks (and

their apparently more "commercial" sound).< 

ummm.  okay.  well, i'm defiantly not one of dem..

>And all this jibber-jabber about people taking "chances" and playing
different styles in a set...wtf???? I 
have been doing that from day one and really don't see it as a huge
leap. I 
mean, if it's all in the same frickin' BPM range or mixable in 1/2 time,
how 
hard is it to mix, and how much of a "chance" are you taking (unless you

have a struck up crowd that only wants one sound all night long)? 99% of
EDM 
that has come out since the mid 90's practically mixes itself!!!<

more than just taking chances with diff styles of music dude.  what i
meant, and *APPARENTLY* should have elaborated on, was doing MORE than
tossin a couple records together one after the other.  programming,
creativity, track selection, tricks, rockin doubles, jugglin the beats
yo, reading the crowd, doing something you have NEVER heard anyone do
before, taking the listeners on a journey - not just *playing* records
for an hour and a half.   

>I think people just need to pull the poles out of their dances and
start 
having fun.<

huh.  yeah...i suppose a pole would defiantly prevent one from having
fun now wouldn't it?  there goes your endorsement deal with
pole-squatters.com  

damn.

;)

> well as my first BSP to let you all know that Secret
> Society is back! Took a nice year long break, and now
> we're back better than ever at a brand new downtown
> San Jose venue. Mark your calendars for the LAST
> TUESDAY OF EVERY MONTH. Our kickoff night in January
> was exeptional... around 150 people showed up while

> a couple of San Francisco guest house playas -->
>
> SECRET SOCIETY - TUESDAY FEBRUARY 22, 2005
>
> with djs:
>
> ANDREW PHELAN (Thump Radio, Turnaround-Sound, Olive
> Records)

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Reviews: DJ Hell, Alien Autopsy, Dirty, and another brief rant

Now I would not call myself a good DJ, I would call myself an average jock. 
Compared to most I have heard on this list. But sounds like Sean needed to 
be at the past DEF SF party.. That I had the pleasure of playing at.. I know 
Tooting your own horn is so lame and cheesy, but since I rarely play tekno I 
think it needs to be said since not a super huge crowd attended but still a 
very cool party. But back to my point, First half of my set was straight up 
old skewl 95 acid breaks, Can you say Nation 12, Basco, Meat beat manifesto 
etc.. and take that right into "Drummy Trax techno" which most tekno snobs 
on this list scoff at.. but I have to tell you that almost every person that 
was at that party in the main room was shaking there bootay...

USER rocks... Tekino snobs suck!

My 50 cent y0!!

Macadio





>
>In general, I think techno DJs have a lot to learn about creating some
>semblance of flow in their sets, and either finding records that
>actually DO something, or learning how to mix really quickly (and
>skillfully) so that people like me don't get bored after 32 bars of the
>same fucking distorted drum machine loops. And would it *really* hurt to
>throw an electro track in every once in a while, or even break things
>down with some tech-house, perhaps something with an actual BASSLINE?
>Seriously, people: there's too much good music out there for everyone to
>be playing that crap exclusively.

>>>>>> > >have
>>>>>> >been happiest when we've given them straight-up hard techno.  The 
>>>>>> > >times
>>>>>> >we've tried to branch out an explore different sides of techno were 
>>>>>> > >not
>>>>>> >exactly our most successful events.  When we threw Robot Feelings, a
>>>>>> >techno and electro party at Cellspace last year, the Droid Behavior 
>>>>>> > >guys

>>>>>> >enough". >I
>>>>>> >want to do parties the way I like them, but I want to make the 
>>>>>> >people > >who
>>>>>> >attend happy too.  This may be an impossibility, as we're not quite
>>>>>> >"techno enough" for techno kids I guess.
>>>>>> >
>>>>>> >Alien Autopsy satisfied all the usual techno party requirements. 
>>>>>> > >Dark;
>>>>>> >check. Hard; check. Spooky and evil; check. Anoraks; well, I didn't 
>>>>>> > >see
>>>>>> >any, but I'm sure there must have been an anorak or two being worn 
>>>>>> > >there
>>>>>> >somewhere.  And I did notice a few bald guys.  Maybe techno ravers 
>>>>>> > >don't
>>>>>> >want their party formula to be messed with.  It seems to me that 
>>>>>> >this >is
>>>>>> >how they like it.  There was no question of this party not being 
>>>>>> > >"techno
>>>>>> >enough".  It had all the bases covered, and people loved it.
>>>>>> >
>>>>>> >There are so many different facets of the SF techno scene, lots of > 
>>>>>> > >little
>>>>>> >micro-scenes. I would love to see the scene become more united, but 
>>>>>> > >the
>>>>>> >problem with techno snobs is that they get so into their thing that 
>>>>>> > >they
>>>>>> >have a hard time looking beyond their own subgenre oriented 
>>>>>> > >microscene.
>>>>>> >
>>>>>> >Maybe this is a bad analogy, but I see it like this--  The 
>>>>>> >Democratic
>>>>>> >party has become increasingly weak because of all the squabbling and
>>>>>> >divisions within the party, whereas the Republican party is much 
>>>>>> >more
>>>>>> >united and unfortunately has become a lot stronger than the 
>>>>>> >Democrats
>>>>>> >because of their unity and passion.  Despite the lack of quality in 
>>>>>> > >the
>>>>>> >trance scene, the enthusiasm and unity found in the candy kid world 
>>>>>> > >has
>>>>>> >kept the trance scene alive and strong long after we've all declared 
>>>>>> > >it
>>>>>> >dead several times. SF's techno scene, like the Democrats, will 
>>>>>> >never >be
>>>>>> >strong if we continue to be divided along sub-genre lines. 
>>>>>> > >Furthermore,
>>>>>> >your average techno fan now, after seeing their music be ignored by 
>>>>>> > >most
>>>>>> >rave promoters and regularly get confused with trance, has become 
>>>>>> > >jaded
>>>>>> >and apathetic.  If we are divided, jaded, and apathetic, techno will 
>>>>>> > >be
>>>>>> >going nowhere fast!
>>>>>> >
>>>>>> >I want to see anorak-wearing minimal guys dancing to funky techno! I 
>>>>>> > > >want
>>>>>> >nosebleed schranz DJs to start buying electro records!  I want to 
>>>>>> >see
>>>>>> >people support the techno scene with enthusiasm and passion! And I 
>>>>>> > >have >no
>>>>>> >problem with hearing janky piano riffs in techno tracks!
>>>>>> >
>>>>>> >Perhaps you have been slightly dissapointed with recent techno 
>>>>>> >events, > >but
>>>>>> >things are changing.  This is going to be our year.  ;)
>>>>>> >
>>>>>> >

Subject: [sfraves] Reviews: DJ Hell, Alien Autopsy, Dirty, and another brief rant

Well the way i look at it is that the unhappy people are always way more 
vocal then the people who had a really good time.  Thats why less then 1% of 
China is really communist because that percent bitched and complained and 
did stuff to change their situation and now they run the biggest country in 
the world and they are the minority by a long shot.

Its easy to listen to people wine and complain, but the fact is that a lot 
of thoose people will do nothing to change their situation.  We have done 
many Techno events over the years and have always  been branded by one 
techno group or another as not "techno" enough for them, and you know what 
we alway struggle but we keep doing it.  Why because we believe in the 
SOOUND.

Funny thing is, is when i was talking to some friends from the UK they were 
totally amazed at how diversified our parties our over here.  They told me 
that they wouldn't even think of  putting two different genres in the same 
room, and that it probably wouldn't work over there.

I think its just irritating thats all, how snobby everybody is.  Does what i 
drive make a difference how much you like my set as well?  i drive a 
Volkswagen... Flame Away.

G

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Reviews: DJ Hell, Alien Autopsy, Dirty, and another brief rant

Genres, when you really get down to it, are marketing tools.  People should 
play the music they love, and turn people on to the music they love.  If a 
DJ concerns themselves too much with just pleasing the audience the DJ is 
losing half the point of what they are doing.  It's dance music, it should 
be helping people transcend their daily lives.  Does it really matter if the 
transcendence comes from House or techno or even <gasp> rock.

Subject: [sfraves] [SRR] - PA System subwoofers for SALE!!!

I have 2 Community XLT415 (4x15") Sub's for sale.

Specs:
http://www.loudspeakers.net/files/specs/new/xlt415.pdf

They were previously owned by an individual who did sound for
clubs/parties/events.  Some of you might know him, his name was Ira. 
Well anyway, when he moved he gave these 2 subs to me, and i really
have no use for them.  They've been sitting in my living room for the
last year, and well I want to get rid of them.  They still work and
are in great condition, aside from a little cat hair on the carpeting
which i can clean off.  There's an extra set of casters that come
along with them.  I'm not looking for a whole lot out of them.  I'd
say probably $750 for each on, or the best offer that comes along, so
feel free to toss any offer into the ring, as i know not a whole lot
of you would be bidding for them i wouldn't think.  but i figure these
speakers helped our scene along the way, may as well keep them within
the same scene.  I havent had too much luck selling them on Ebay or
anything because they're a bitch to ship.  Each one weighs in around
180lbs.  I'm going to be moving in May and i would like to get rid of
these before i have to move because i wont have anywhere to store them
when i get my new place.  Hopefully one of you or perhaps a friend of
yours can give these big boys a nice new home where they will be
appreciated.  For those of you who have been to Ryan and I's house
parties in the last year you may reconize them as those big black
boxes that were sitting in the corner of the living room.  i can
provide actual pictures of the speakers if you'd like and can schedule
just about anytime to come over and inspect them if you'd like as
there is generally one person home all day.  So please please help me
out and help these speakers out.

Email any inquires to me at my other account.  dj_t_ray@yahoo.com

-- 
Chester Copperpot

The trip goes on forever
By Pepe Escobar

Hunter Thompson (1937-2005)

"We were angry and righteous in those days, and there were millions of us. 
We kicked two chief executives out of the White House because they were 
stupid warmongers. We conquered Lyndon Johnson and we stomped on Richard 
Nixon - which wise people said was impossible, but so what? It was fun. We 
were warriors then, and our tribe was strong like a river."
- "Fear and Loathing, Campaign 2004", Hunter Thompson's last published 
article in Rolling Stone

"Between the idea and the reality ... falls the shadow."
Hunter Thompson's favorite T S Eliot quote

"We were somewhere around Barstow on the edge of the desert when the drugs 
began to take hold. I remember saying something like 'I feel a bit 
lightheaded; maybe you should drive ...' And suddenly there was a terrible 
roar all around us and the sky was full of what looked like huge bats, all 
swooping and screeching and diving around the car, which was going about a 
hundred miles an hour with the top down to Las Vegas. And a voice was 
screaming: 'Holy Jesus! What are these goddamn animals?'"

MORE:  http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Front_Page/GB23Aa03.html






Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

The Bench and Bar is a huge club in downtown Oakland, with a LOUD sound
system, large wooden dance floor, 3-mile long bar and a smoking patio.

http://www.tigerbeat6.com/index.php?id=3_70

"Wrong Application expands the palate of noise, minimalism, electronic,
experimental and computer music with pristine, ear-popping soundwaves all
composed under the same rule. All songs were created using only source
material other than soundfiles: TIFFs, text, Photoshop files, emails, raw
code, even another application. Anything was game to farm for audio
material except actual audio."

Subject: [sfraves] srr: Pioneer DJM-707 mixer and mixer suggestions?

anyone have any suggestions for a mixer in the $250-$400 range?

i'd really like to get a new mixer, but can't really afford anything
past $400 (maybe $500).  i've been doing some searches and the price
on the Pioneer DJM-707 has dropped to $299.

tech info here:
http://www.pioneerprodj.com/ (go to products, mixers, DJM 707)

and a review here:
http://remixmag.com/dj_and_performance/remix_pioneer_djm_djm/

what i'm looking for in a mixer:
- solid crossfader so i can pretend to scratch
- solid eqs to twiddle and twist
- good enough sound quality so that we can use it at shows at
small/mid sized venues (like 330 Ritch)
- something that's not going to fall apart on me
- option for effects in/out
- i have a thing against really wide mixers.  19" is just to far for
my tables to be apart

i know.  everyone is going to say "get a rane!!!"

--

THE BASS INVADERZ TOUR hits SF for one Night Only

Starring
DJ FRESH breakbeat kaos / dogs on acid / uk
DIESELBOY human imprint / philadelphia
MC J MESSINIAN platinum / philadelphia

Featuring
METHOD ONE clandestine / levitated / method-one.com
MC DUH groundscore / phuturo

Get your bassbin fill and dance like crazy alongside your SF Bay Area
D&B family.

See you there!

Get down with DJ Fresh's newest mix CD (BASS INVADERZ) on Human
Imprint, available
everywhere music is sold and if you're lucky you might get one at the show.

1015 Folsom SF / doors at 9pm / $5 before 11pm $10 after / 21+ With ID

--- Bam <invibe@gmail.com> wrote:

> anyone have any suggestions for a mixer in the
> $250-$400 range?
> 
> i'd really like to get a new mixer, but can't really
> afford anything
> past $400 (maybe $500).  i've been doing some
> searches and the price
> on the Pioneer DJM-707 has dropped to $299.
> 
> tech info here:
> http://www.pioneerprodj.com/ (go to products,
> mixers, DJM 707)
> 
> and a review here:
>
http://remixmag.com/dj_and_performance/remix_pioneer_djm_djm/
> 
> what i'm looking for in a mixer:
> - solid crossfader so i can pretend to scratch
> - solid eqs to twiddle and twist
> - good enough sound quality so that we can use it at
> shows at
> small/mid sized venues (like 330 Ritch)
> - something that's not going to fall apart on me
> - option for effects in/out
> - i have a thing against really wide mixers.  19" is
> just to far for
> my tables to be apart
> 
> i know.  everyone is going to say "get a rane!!!"
> 
> --

Subject: [sfraves] Cannabass was CannaDope lastnight!!

fuck it.. so i ended up going 2 Bench & Bar 4 CannaBass... YAY!!  I so
glad i did!!!

So as soon as i walked in, i was greeeted by Family!!  YAY!!!  So Dope! 
Diatrybe was on the decks spinning some awesome hard jungle,, I dunno...
jump up I guess... lol... but yeah.. it was sick... then E$KR was on after
him.. he started out pretty raga jungle (I think, well, that's what it
sounded like) then went in2 strait up hard, yummy, dnb... YUM!!! Oh my
gosh.. I LOVED THESE SETS.. I think there were some original tunes in
these sets...

After him was this Dude from Sac.. dunno what his name was.. Mike i
think... then Lewt went on after him... I dunno... I was still DMAO, but i
didn't know i was gonna be there, so I just handled as much floor as
possible w/o ear plugs...

It was a totally fun night.. then rat-a-tat-Pat gave me a ride home...

It was so much fun 4 someting so unexpected!  The weekend has begun
y'all!!! 2night it's 1015 4 somemore Jungle!!!  YAY!!!
-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr did Bush smoke pot?

[bush admits to drug use, millions of Americans still being fucked over]

> bit which sounds all good and all, but a more salient question,
> methinks, is how many Texans got locked up and had their lives
> disrupted over marijuana use while he was Governor, and how many have
> gone through this process while he's been President?
> 
> At least one 'Homicide by Justice' comes to mind:
> 
> http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A10798-2004Oct29.html
> 
> If that's not cold-blooded murder, over nothing, I don't know what is.
> 
> When Prohibition got lifted in 1933, Roosevelt shared a Martini with the Nation.
> ( http://www.thatsthespirit.com/en/Mixology/articles/martini.asp
> /olive green sidebar, lower right hand)
> 
> Would that we would see that kind of Leadership from the White House today.
> 
> Nope, way too much money in keeping it 'illicit,' and keeping those
> addictive Xanax scrips flowing.

the money is exactly it. when Prohibition was lifted, alcohol prices
dropped. the criminalization of drugs is effectively just a subsidy.

this is really just a conspiracy theory, but I think it really all
comes down to the Mafia. after Prohibition, the Mafia had been
transformed from a ragtag collective of independent operations into a
consolidated federation. the huge nationwide demand for illegal
alcohol made heroes out of smugglers and provided huge motivation for
regional organizations to connect with one another.

but that was nothing compared to Las Vegas. if Prohibition made the
Mafia into a serious nationwide system, owning the economy of the
entire state of Nevada made it into a serious political force. they
started with two senators and went from there. if you ran an illegal
organization which owed its status and power originally to the
criminalization of alcohol, and running that organization had given
you the power to remove Presidents from office whenever they drove
past a grassy knoll, would you be after more power, or less power?
Mafiosos are not known for their humility or wisdom. not the type of
people who'd pass up an opportunity to entrench their organization as
a permanent aspect of the American way of life just because it
happened to be inconvenient for a few hippies and ravers, or for any
particular representatives of the numerous non-Italian ethnicities
living in this country.

then again, it wasn't just the Mafia. it was also the penguins. watch
out for the penguins, man. they don't fuck around.

-- 
DJ Soundwave

so many sound geeks and djs have said otherwise about the Mackies!

As for lists to go to, I've heard some valuable advice on the Amtrak
Djs list.  You can easily do a search for them online but I will see
if I can find some info for you.

From: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>
X-X-Sender: andy@atari
To: Bam <invibe@gmail.com>
cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
In-Reply-To: <7a86c50c05022510352c1349bc@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.LNX.4.62.0502251114350.24730@atari>
References: <7a86c50c05022510352c1349bc@mail.gmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] srr: sound system advice?


Honestly, for that application and price range, go used.  You could 
probably get into a used Community system pretty cheap.

The mackies on a stick + sub don't sound all that hot.  Great for playing 
jazz at a coffee shop running at 1/4 their stated capacity... but just not 
solid loud+good in reality.

My system was more for the 100-150 sized crowd.

First i figured out my design limitations

* had to run almost full blast off one circuit (15 amps, but let's say 
12 cause amps pull power funny).

* had to fit in the back of a small pickup truck.

* had to be easy to set up.

* sound quality was worth spending a bit more for

Ended up with:

Rack:
dbx 1066 compressor
rane 22 band stereo eq
rane 2 way crossover
crest audio v450 - top power
crest audio ca9 - bass power
mackie m-1200 amp - monitor power

Cabs:
jbl sr series 2x15" trapezoidal cabinets
jbl mr series 12" 2 way tops
ev 2 way 12" for monitors

That and a good balanced cable set, extension cords, stands, coffin, blah 
blah blah... it just goes on for days.

Sold it all to Cloud Factory after I realized everybody who I thought was 
my friend actually just wanted free/cheap sound.  B, if you want me to go 
with you to shop some stuff, I have no qualms being the guy at the pro 
audio store who asks annoying questions and helps deal shit down.

Also, if anybody is in the market for a larger sound system (~= 5000 watt 
McCauley cab + Crown amp based system), I know a guy who is getting rid of 
one used that is in great shape.  Sounds *great*, amazing system that 
would totally excel at a club installation, but is small enough to drag 
all over the place (bit much for say, a renegade beach party a couple 
hundred yards down the sand... but great for campouts or something like 
Sunset).

Note: the only piece of gear that ever died on me was the Mackie amp.  
Twice.  And actually, even after two factory repairs, one channel was way 
hotter than the other, and it had a tendency to overheat at parties... 
pushing a 100 watt pair of 8 ohm monitors.  I LOVE my 1604 mixer, I swear 
by it... Mackie makes a badass project studio mixer.  But I am yet to be 
impressed by their sound reinforcement gear.  Usually performs way under 
stated specs (weak for wattage, more distortion than they claim, etc) and 
they still seem mostly designed for voice/mellower music playback.  Most 
everybody I know that went with Mackie based sound systems has been 
hurting on repairs, reliabilty, shaky performance at full/near full volume 
and durability.

andyw

Subject: Re: [sfraves] srr: sound system advice?

Well, Community Loudspeakers offers free shipping on orders over $4,000. So 
what I did was do an order with an instalation dealer in Oregon, where he 
had them drop ship my part of the order directly to me. Had to go through 
Communitie's Western regional wholesale rep to do it, but we figured it all 
out. I had to go pick it up at Yellow Freight in Sacramento, but it was 
worth it. I got six cabinets, all at wholesale, with no tax and no shipping 
costs.

That's a good way to start. It was a bitch for work, and took over a month 
to get them. But what would have cost me $5,000 in retail cost and sales tax 
cost me $1,800.

There's really good deals on Amps on-line. On my third soudsystem, I've 
become a big fan of Community cabinets and Crest amps. I use this for my 
subs...

http://www.8thstreet.com/product.asp?ProductCode=24155&Category=Power_Amplifiers

But I paid a little less than this for it. However, that is still a very 
good price.

I use two of these...

http://www.poweralley.com/lt1500.htm

one for my dual tower's and one for my single 15" cabinets.

Search around, really good deals out there on these Crest LT series amps 
right now. They rival most Crowns. No joke.

What brings it all together is the DBX Driverack. I've used all kinds of 
crossovers, EQ's, and compressors but this one really does what it's 
supposed to. I'm confident that it's the most important link in the chain. I 
got it from here...

http://www.northernsound.net

They are my secret weapon! No tax, no shipping, and always the lowest price 
on everything. They just don't carry everything.

My system gets serious compliments every week. From new people. And it cost 
me less than buying a comperable set of Mackie Active speakers.

Only thing is, no good for DnB, needs more bass. We use one of the new 
Mackie Fusion subs just for extra kick when we do DnB shows (untill we get 
two more Community subs).

I'm hardly a sound geek though. Wish I was but I'm not. Just did some 
reaserch and got lucky with it. It's seriously mind boggling that we got 
this kind of sound out of this plan, and budget.



- Gavin Varitech
(916) 412-3313 - Info/Bookings/Contact
www.djvaritech.net  www.techwesttribe.com

NEED A HOME LOAN? Hit me up... I promise to be the most competitive deal 
you'll find.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Web Geeks:  I need some help w/ cgi email!!!

--0-1950964401-1109371296=:26611
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

these are the instructions that were provided to me by my host (this is driving me mad:
 
6. Make sure the ACTION is correct.The trickiest part of the HTML form is getting the ACTION set correctly. Start with the URL of your e-mail template, then split it into two parts, e.g. 
http://web.mit.edu/wwwdev/cgiemail/questions3.txt\                /\                             / `--- Part 1 ---'  ` -------- Part 2 ----------'
First type the URL of your e-mail template into a web browser and make sure it's correct. Then put the script name in the middle. Usually this is ``/cgi-bin/cgiecho'', but it depends on how your server is configured. On web.mit.edu it happens to be ``/bin/cgiecho'', thus my ACTION looks like this: 
http://web.mit.edu/bin/cgiecho/wwwdev/cgiemail/questions3.txt\                /\          /\                             / `--- Part 1 ---'  script name ` -------- Part 2 ----------'
For simplicity, you may leave out part 1, but you must include it if you want to test your form as a local file. If you don't know what that means, just feel free to omit part 1. 

Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
You need the "form action" to go to a cgi executable, not a text file:

http://www.djpistachio.com/cgi-bin/cgiemail/emaillist.txt

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Web Geeks:  I need some help w/ cgi email!!!

Those instructions assume some kind of web server rewriting foo.
Presumably "cgiemail" is the name of a script?

http://www.djpistachio.com/cgi-bin/cgiemail

returns a "403 Forbidden". You need to set up your web server to pemit
this script to execute.


On Fri, 25 Feb 2005, Carlos S wrote:

> these are the instructions that were provided to me by my host (this is driving me mad:
>
> 6. Make sure the ACTION is correct.The trickiest part of the HTML form is getting the ACTION set correctly. Start with the URL of your e-mail template, then split it into two parts, e.g.
> http://web.mit.edu/wwwdev/cgiemail/questions3.txt\                /\                             / `--- Part 1 ---'  ` -------- Part 2 ----------'
> First type the URL of your e-mail template into a web browser and make sure it's correct. Then put the script name in the middle. Usually this is ``/cgi-bin/cgiecho'', but it depends on how your server is configured. On web.mit.edu it happens to be ``/bin/cgiecho'', thus my ACTION looks like this:
> http://web.mit.edu/bin/cgiecho/wwwdev/cgiemail/questions3.txt\                /\          /\                             / `--- Part 1 ---'  script name ` -------- Part 2 ----------'
> For simplicity, you may leave out part 1, but you must include it if you want to test your form as a local file. If you don't know what that means, just feel free to omit part 1.
>
> Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
> You need the "form action" to go to a cgi executable, not a text file:
>
> http://www.djpistachio.com/cgi-bin/cgiemail/emaillist.txt
>
>
>
> On Fri, 25 Feb 2005, Carlos S wrote:
>
> > I know someone on this list can help me!
> >
> > I am making myself a little website (haven't done this in a while and i'm not very knowledgeable) and i'm having trouble with cgi email. I want for visitors to be able to submit to me their email addresses and names so i can compile a mailing list. i can't get it to work!!!!
> >
> > i know i'm not describing much, but if someone can go to my page http://www.djpistachio.com and try it out and look at the code, i would greatly appreciate it.
> >
> > thanks!
> >
> > carlos

Subject: [sfraves] Free! Pet rats to be your little buddy!!

Hello friends,

I recently bought a female rat from the pet store, and she was
pregnant!  Now I have 11 little ones scurrying around, waiting for the
perfect place in YOUR heart!

Reasons you should have a rat (or 2)
-they don't make noise (or stink, if you change the cage)
-they don't talk back to you
-they can be potty trained
-they are very intelligent, they can come when called, be trained to
do tricks, etc.
-They are very sociable, and male rats will make good 'lap pets', my
female rides contentedly on my shoulder for hours.
-they are little compost machines... they will eat any table scraps
you want to give them
-they live in a cage, which means you can put them away (unlike children)

These rats have been handled almost from birth, are very tame
(suitable for children 6+), and come when they are called (for the
most part).  They are very lively and bouncy, and they have been given
antibiotics through breastmilk for the fist few weeks of their life. 
They love to play, especially the boys.  It's more amusing that TV
watching their antics in the cage!!!

If you are interested in getting a rat (and I recommend a pair, they
can live in the same small space and solitary rats get cold and
lonely), please have a cage with at least 1/2 inch bars (if not
smaller).  The cage is the most expensive thing you will need, or you
can make one.  Or, check CL for listings about free cages (they exist,
I swear).  Other than that, you will want bedding, a food bowl, and a
water bottle, as well as food (duh.)


Please help these CUTE rats live long, happy, fat lives!  Let them
enrich your life as well.

Mail me off list if you're interested!

-Sabra

"This struggle may be a moral one, or it may be a
physical one, and it may be both moral and physical,
but it must be a struggle. Power concedes nothing
without a demand. It never did and it never will. Find
out just what any ! people will quietly submit to and
you have found out the exact measure of injustice and
wrong which will be imposed upon them, and these will
continue till they are resisted with either words or
blows, or with both. The limits of tyrants are
prescribed by the endurance of those whom they
oppress." ~ Frederick Douglass, 1857

& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.

Administrative Notes=20

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:=20
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] Oh... Thursday night was SO Dope: T BDAY &  BASS INVADERS

OK.. the evening started out w/ a really yummy noodle dinner & some drinks
& some NUMMY HAPPYHARDCORE BITHDAY TIM FRUIT COCKTAIL cake.. YUMMY!!! 
LoL.. yeah... I was kinda beat 4 some odd reason so i napped.. when i woke
well... Eryn woke me up whispering my name... hmmm.. that's either really
romantic or hella scary thinkin' about that now... LoL... but other people
there were also Angie, Becca, Eva (ofcourse =), ummm... their 1 hella Cute
friend from Isreal who lives here now I 4got her name, & Henry.. Oh oh
oh.. & Brook & her 2 friends Ben & hella tall Girl showed up also!!  YAY!!
 Then we all walked 2 1015.. some people like took off already... but we
got there... YAY!!

I was already kinda tipsy 'cause I had a drink in honor of Tim & I said I
wasn't gonna get drunk or anything that night 'cause I wanted 2
dance!!!OK.. Literally, as I walked through the door, I was handed a
drink, then shortly after that, another drink, & a drink ticket... later
on in the night, I was handed another beer... ok.. that tosses any pre
planning not getting drunnk plans i have or make.. Hello 2day.. LoL

OK... 1st I gotta talk about people & vibe... 1 of the reasons I've been
so damn fuckin' a happy camper junglist all these yeears is the LOVE... I
mean... I Love my Jungle Family, I Love the vibe that U just can't find
anywhere else, I Love the energy!!  SEriously man... when it's a Jungle
event, I always feel @ home even more so like when i'm @ some kinda family
rave 'cause alota the people I Love are there... so yeah... it was Love 4
who I hung out w/ & even the unsuspcted baby junglists who were kickin' it
there!  WOOOOOOOOHOOOOOOOOO  I mean... just where ever I walked or ended
stayin 4 bits @ time... Oooh.. LOVE!  YAY

OK.. now Music... I don't remember who was on the decks 1st.. but he was
sick... MC DUH was on the mic, so I ran up 2 the booth he was @ & shook
his hand.. LoL... then i was dancin' ''cause there was soo much floor
'cause it was still early, 10:30ish, then I heard my name coming from the
speaker & something about chicken salad... LMAO.. Hello 2day.. so fun!! 
Love U Max!

but the 1st DJ was Dope!!  the 2nd DJ was FRESH from the UK (right?)....
he was Sick... Threw down alota Groovy track.. but intoxicating levels of
alcohol were fucking w/ my mentality (lke I knew would happen) that I was
only able 2 grab floor 4 probably 1/2 this set overall then the other 1/2
I socialized & yeah...

I knew when DieselBoy went on 'cause the style of Jungle like mildly
changed 2 something else & I waaaaas Groovin' hard on well.. the side of
the floor 4 a while... LoL

Thankfully I found a crash pad (Thanks Max) in Berkeley & had the most
entertaing night cap ever which involed snadwiches, water, killer fish, &
LIFETIME... waking up yesterday & nursing a hangover was not the funnest
thing in the world...

Oh yeah.. I've been like getting re-aquianted w/ MC Child again & him & I
have been like totally getting tight again... oh yeah... if U want a
really entertaing, fun, Dope, Strong British accented MC dude 2 like host
your DJs @ your events or MC your event... hit me up 4 his contact info
'cause he's comin' out of hiding & wantes 2 play again w/ every1!  LoL :)

Yo Tim... hope your Birthday was Magical Dude!!!  Sorry I couldn't find
y'all after the 1st hour.. but I was kinda lost myself after that...


-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

writes:


>=20
>=20
> i know.=A0 everyone is going to say "get a rane!!!"
>=20
>=20

save up for the pioneer djm909. it should be well worth the wait. i can see=20
the pioneer djm 909 being as standard as the djm 500 in a few years.=20

ranes are solid but i'v seen a few blow up here and there... though the one=20
they've got hooked up to a sewing machine on their website seems like its in=
=20
favor with alot of djs.=20

i think allen and heath mixers, while in the sound control department are=20
excellent but are more suited to sound techs than your average dj.=20

vestax has awesome fader control and some vicious line level eq kills but ar=
e=20
rumored to have cheap parts that break ..-though the vestax ISP is one honey=
=20
of a mixer.=20

 though all these are great mixers/companies i'd still be right to drool ove=
r=20
the djm909. its built in fx variable fader controls, multiple sends ins/=20
outs, quality EQ and easy layout design make it a real artist's mixer. (no,=20=
i=20
don't work for pioneer)

on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_692265==.ALT--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] WARNING: drinks getting spiked at recent DnB events

Something similar was on the news last week.   Vics vomitting blood and waking up in the ER with
empty pockets, one less sportscar, and a fresh understanding of "Can you watch my drink?"

Didn't someone on-list suspect something like this a few months ago?  He was poo-poo'd for having
too many drinks and losing his keys.  That's usually my excuse when my keys come up missing, but
there are plenty of creepies out there.  Like the thug next door who asked me a few years ago to
get him some GHB at my next rave so he could try out raping a chic.  No shit.

That memory just gave me creepy goosebumps.  

It'd be nice if that dude has been stopped by a runaway uptown bus, or a cement truck going too
fast.  But he's probably doing just fine.  Sadly.  

Yup, shit goes down.   Watch your back & travel in packs.  And be ready to step up to thugs, like
Terrac did that time.  I think that was Terrac, no?  Whipping the shotgun out of his trenchcoat
and doing judo kicks all over that gang of jacket thieves?    I remember clearly because that was
the night I ate that really good acid.

It's kinda cool when ravers throw down on shitheads.  For me, the ecstasy / U.G. mentality isn't
about passivity. It's more like being certain. Like a bizarre breed of soldier with glowsticks &
self-conviction..   


For example--   This one time, some country bumpkin from Walnut Creek showed up at a party and
said, "Is that techno music y'all playin?"

We stomped the shit out of that guy. Cuz we all knew it was glitchy post-Miami bootycore.

Haha.
 
But for real:  Guard your scene. Do good shit. And can you watch my drink?

booms

on tour in your town very soon!

For more information on Zeropoint Recordings and future releases, please=20
visit http://www.zeropointrecords.com/.
For booking inquiries, please contact Charity Gallagher of Sublunary Artist=20
Management at Charity@SublunaryAM.Com.=20
Sublunary Artist Management
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Fon: 001.515.991.8393
Web: http://www.sublunaryam.com/
AIM: Sublunary AM

Subject: [sfraves] [skylab2000] new CD out! - audio sample online


For ten years we have secretly recorded skylab2000 live sets, and now we are excited to release some of these live tracks in a series 
of CDs called LIVE BOOTLEG. This is the first in the series- "LIVE BOOTLEG B001".

Each CD will contain a few live tracks from a live show sometime in the many years we have been touring. Yes, they have noises and 
mistakes and all the good stuff that comes with real live recordings!

Each CD will be available for a limited time only, and then the next one will be released, so get yours while you can. This series 
starts off at a special price of ONLY $5!! For a limited time only, we'll also cover the shipping and taxes and you pay just FIVE 
DOLLARS TOTAL! 

(Big thanks to those of you who already ordered the new CD. Great response!) 



Full info on LIVE BOOTLEG B001 and ordering info is at http://skylab2000.com/b001.htm 

Or listen to an audio sample: http://skylab2000.com/b001sample.m3u



Lastly, if you are interested in hearing from skylab2000 a bit more often and getting details of shows and releases, please reply and 
just say "sign me up". Still only about 2-3 messages a month, but lots more info!
Thanks for reading! 

[Check out http://skylab2000.com]

CC:  sfraves@hyperreal.org
References: <001b01c51dc8$264b2210$6401a8c0@andrew>
In-Reply-To: <001b01c51dc8$264b2210$6401a8c0@andrew>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: Folded - More Info

Something I have noticed for years now with DJ's and crews and BSPs and 
stuff is the long trail of affiliations that come after a name. 
Sometimes it's really cool because I see a label I like or a crew I am 
down with, sometimes it is a total mystery or even an inside joke 
amongst crew or family. I guess what I appreciate is whenever slightly 
more information can be given like a web URL that encourages checking 
out someone's affiliations in more detail or the rest of a label's 
artists. Also I like little useful blurbs, like if there is a new 
project a bit about the effort and to go check it out. I don't always 
pay attention to house labels or people's projects but I like the music 
enough where if I like a representative sound from that label I might go 
out and browse through what is out there or I might go check someone live.

Anyway, just a note of encouragement to everyone to fill us all in on 
new projects and affiliations and stuff when you can - especially for 
larger events - it is good to see folks active and busy doing the music 
we all love. Party onward.

donb

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: Folded - More Info

I find after so many years of reading BSPs that I want the information
quick and done, I personally don't like reading a load of hype or a bunch
of extra text so that's how I post my BSPs.  Generally with so many events
going on these days, odds are if I don't recognize the crew, DJ, or
affiliations off the bat I'm not going to pay much attention anyway. 
That's just me though.  Google is your friend too.  Other sites from the
affiliations:

www.oliverecords.com
www.thumpradio.com
www.newstylesound.com

Our night is all hoose music.

-Andrew

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: Folded - More Info

--- donb <mutex@drghetto.com> wrote:

> Something I have noticed for years now with DJ's and crews and BSPs
> and 
> stuff is the long trail of affiliations that come after a name. 
> Sometimes it's really cool because I see a label I like or a crew I
> am 
> down with, sometimes it is a total mystery or even an inside joke 
> amongst crew or family. 

Good point, Don.  Here's a bit of background on the ones we posted, and
I think I'll append a little blurb with further info on it to further
posts of ours.

(btw, you may know some or all of this info, just posting so folks that
don't will be filled in)

Turnaround-Sound is a local house label owned by Sen-Sei, noted
keyboardist who is known for playing live with djs and for contributing
keys to a lot of prominent folks' productions as well as his own.  TAS
is on their second release now (a track by Andrew and I called "Friday
Night" with a Chris Lum remix and some remixes by Sen-Sei, and Naz of
In-House fame).  The previous release was a Patrick Turner track with a
really good mix by Jeno and more mixes by Sen-Sei and Naz.  

Sen-Sei is playing with Andrew and I this friday, doing his
live-keys-over-dj-music thing.  He'll be tag-teaming with our pal RFM,
who plays in the local band Loquat- another exceptional keyboardist.

Sf-Vibe is a local promoter group that tends to throw deep/funky house
music events.  They do smaller club stuff (like Taco Tuesdays at Luna
and Cruise Liner at Lingba Lounge) and some larger big-club events. 
Jonas does promotion with them and plays at some of the events.

newstylesound is my little deep tech house label (you knew that :)
which is gearing up to release a new 12" soon, a track of mine
(Origami) called "Everydaylife" with remixes by dj2 and Andrew and I.  

Olive Records is a Chicago-based record label that is co-owned by
french house guys Synthique (aka Max & Brian).  They put out some
big-room banging stuff (like High Caliber) and some jazzier chicago-y
stuff (like Sound Navigators, who Andrew and I did a remix for on
Olive), along with Synthique's frenchy frenchy stuff.  They are cool
cats and all the records of theirs I've heard are great.

Pancake is Grant Dell (UK tech-house dj/producer)'s label (or one of
them).  They recently re-issued dj2 (Delaney Parker and I's duo)'s
first single, "Plural" with a mix by Mazi.  Great music so far on that
label, the previous release being a celebrated cut by Masonic Noodles.

..and you know Thump Radio, but for those that don't, they're a driving
force in the local trance/house/chill community, throwing many club
events large and small, along with their weekly dj mix shows that play
on XM radio as well as select FM stations.  

That be that, I think.  

Cheers mate,
---
-george C | origami
-newstylesound recordings
-newstylesound.com
-djorigami.com
-foldedsf

---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Is Your Child a Goth?

--=====================_11229336==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Is Your Child a Goth? Presented by St. Mary's Church

Listed below are some warning signs to indicate if your child may have gone 
astray from the Lord. Gothic (or Goth) is a very obscure and often 
dangerous culture that young teenagers are prone to participating in. The 
gothic culture leads young, susceptible minds into an imagined world of 
evil, darkness, and violence. Please seek immediate attention through 
counselling, prayer, and parental guidance to rid your child of Satan's 
temptations if five or more of the following are applicable to your child.

-Frequently wears black clothing.
-Wears band and/or rock t-shirts.
-Wears excessive black eye makeup, lipstick or nail polish.
-Wears any odd silver jewellery or symbols.
-Shows an interest in piercings or tattoos.
-Listens to gothic or any other anti-social genres of music. (Marilyn 
Manson claims to be the anti-Christ, and publicly speaks against the Lord. 
Please discard any such albums IMMEDIATELY.)
-Associates with other people that dresses acts or speaks eccentrically.
-Shows a declining interest in wholesome activities, such as: the Bible, 
prayer, church or sports.
-Shows an increasing interest in death, vampires, magic, the occult, 
witchcraft or anything else that involves Satan.
-Takes drugs.
-Drinks alcohol.
-Is suicidal and/or depressed.
-Cuts, burns or partakes in any other method of self-mutilation.(This is a 
Satanic ritual that uses pain to detract from the light of God and His 
love. Please seek immediate attention for this at your local mental health 
centre.)
-Complains of boredom.
-Sleeps too excessively or too little.
-Is excessively awake during the night.
-Demands an unusual amount of privacy.
-Spends large amounts of time alone.
-Requests time alone and quietness. (This is so that your child may speak 
to evil sprits through meditation.)
-Insists on spending time with friends while unaccompanied by an adult.
-Disregards authority figures; teachers, priests, nuns and elders are but a 
few examples of this.
-Misbehaves at school.
-Misbehaves at home.
-Eats excessively or too little.
-Eats Goth-related foods. Count Dracula cereal is an example of this.
-Drinks blood or expresses an interest in drinking blood. (Vampires believe 
this is how to attain Satan. This act is very dangerous and should be 
stopped immediately.)
-Watches cable television or any other corrupted media sources. (Ask your 
local church for proper programs that your child may watch.) 1
-Plays videos games that contains violence or role-playing nature.
-Uses the Internet excessively and frequently makes time for the computer.
-Makes Satanic symbols and/or violently shakes head to music.
-Dances to music in a provocative or sexual manner.
-Expresses an interest in sex.
-Masturbates.
-Is homosexual and/or bisexual.
-Pursues dangerous cult religions. Such include: Satanism,
Scientology, Philosophy, Paganism, Wicca, Hinduism and Buddhism.
-Wears pins, stickers or anything else that contains these various phrases: 
"I'm so gothic, I'm dead", "woe is me", "I'm a Goth".
-Claims to be a Goth.

If five or more of these apply to your child, please intervene immediately. 
The gothic culture is dangerous and Satan thrives within it. If any of 
these problems persist, enlist your child into your local mental health centre.

St. Mary's Catholic Church
LMAO, Texas





Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] nrr: more mixer fun! decision made by Ebay.

so last week i posted up a query as to new mixer suggestions, but it
turns out that Ebay made the decision for me.

i was interested in  Pioneer DJM-707 which retails at $299, a drop
from the original price of $699.

so i put in a bid on Ebay and got new one for less than $230.

maybe it won't be the best mixer out there, but for $230 i really
can't complain?  and if i hate it, i can just put it on craigslist for
$250.  ;)
